author: {'steamid': '76561197983749619', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 3199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2803, 'last_played': 1562787931}
review:
FUUUUSIOON HA!!

Rompo la tradici√≥n de no hacer un an√°lisis hasta que me acabo un juego y lo desinstalo, porque despu√©s de m√°s de 50 horas me queda juego para rato. 

Trials Fusion es un juego de habilidad, que te da todas las herramientas desde el principio, no se desbloquean habilidades, s√≥lo motos, y tampoco son muchas. Lo importante es c√≥mo vas creciendo como jugador. Desde que a duras penas acabas un circuito f√°cil tras 15 intentos, hasta que consigues realizar uno de los circuitos dif√≠ciles obteniendo una medalla de oro (luego queda el platino, que ya es de otro mundo). 

Art√≠sticamente est√° bien parido.  T√©cnicamente est√° bien resuelto sin despuntar, pero dando fluidez ante el mando, que es lo que importa. La m√∫sica del principio del juego es muy divertida, y en general todo el juego rezuma simpat√≠a y desenfado. Pero eso no quita que pueda llegar a ser muy t√©cnico y DIF√çCIL. Como he comentado antes la curva de dificultad es muy progresiva y lenta, pero implacable. Los niveles de dificultad extrema son realmente un hueso. Ah√≠ es donde me encuentro ahora, cogiendo fuerzas con otros juegos para volver con fuerza a intentar superarlos, aunque sea con la medalla de bronce. Soy un masoca y quiero ver todas las jugarretas que el juego me tiene preparadas. Pain & Gain, amor y dolor. Esa es la relaci√≥n que te propone el juego. No es Dark Souls con motos, ni lo pretende, pero te hace sacar tu faceta competitiva sin despeinarse y te hace repetir fases hasta que las superas, haci√©ndote sentir genial despu√©s.

MUY RECOMENDADO!

Saludos!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960788395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1440, 'last_played': 1505098442}
review: fun game - its as described by devs. I have this and others one several devices, from consoles to pc. great  fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198020921702', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7004, 'last_played': 1675251839}
review:
Great game! The track editor is full of features including triggers. The learning curve can be tough but the results are impressive at times.

One downside is the multiplayer being almost empty all the time. Althought track central is completly different as we see new maps every weeks.

Overall its a great game if you are into time trial races and trial style gameplay. There is also tricks you can perform while jumping.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111133242', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1504642282}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064163351', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1504280854}
review:
Great game, runs smooth as silk on my three monitors. No messing around to get triple screen to work. Endless content with community made maps. 

Uplay certainly made me think twice about buying this - but after a one time setup you never have to interact with it again as you can sync the game to your Steam account.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090232262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1504272001}
review: Looking for new Trials content and challenges? Then this game has it. Looking for lots of cross promotion of extra things you are prompted to buy? Gotcha covered. Looking for unskippable training courses where you have to sit through being told how to accelerate? Check. Looking for broken leaderboards where the top times are sub-second? Look no further. Looking for additional ecosystem you have to download and sign up to in order to receive said unwanted DLC advertisements and broken leaderboard system? Etc...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971263014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1512635954}
review: Amazing customizable levels, riders and bikes. I used to be into dirtbikes and BMX so this is right up my alley. EVery day seems to come with a thousand new maps and every one has its own charm. Between the seriously fun mechanics and challenge to the flat out hilarious and silly secrets/easter eggs this is one game you will keep coming back to for years to come. TRY IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960420670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1503684312}
review:
I understand there's a lot of skill involved in making some of these jumps, particularly in the later stages, but so much of it FEELS like luck. I don't experience elation or satisfaction when I finish a difficult section, only relief that I'll never have to do THAT again.

The option to only see custom tracks that do not require DLC doesn't work. There appears to be no such thing as a custom track that does not require an additional purchase of some kind. If there is, I can't find it, and the developers surely haven't made it easy to find.

Requires Uplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109339407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1503772935}
review:
(Please note that i will be doing a(What I Think of this game series not out of trolling, annoyce, but for my youtube Channel that I will be starting later this year. So in other words don't be afraid to comment on my reivew of these games i leave hear on steam) 

Ah yes Good Ole Famous Red Lynx, when it comes to Trial games they certainly know how to make them and bring the community as a whole for racing and for one i am a huge fan of bike games depending on what it is, how its made, and what your racing with. Red Lynx I discovered through Xbox 360 in the early 2000s back when it was just the stages of making their console titles for Trails, Trails is by far one of the best Bike racing games with its Creator program and vast community store of maps to download and play their is certainly no shortage of bike tracks you can check out and explore and also make your. While i never could figure out cause i mostly stuck with the HALO Genre, Red Lynx program basically you build sides and that took me to the point where i gave up on it and couldn't figure out how to make a straight path on a sideway screen but thats for players who have played Titles of Red Lynx.
               Now Red Lynx is coming out with more titles of Trail and DLC and the phone version such as Trials Frontier which is a fun game and have played many, many many times till the point where my phone is like " HEY MAN PLAY SOMETHING ELSE!" other than Red Lynx Keep up the good work in making more Trail Games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333878533', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1624210852}
review:
I don't know what everyone is talking about. this game is awesome. 
it runs smooth on laptop with a 970m card. i bought the dlc and had no problem getting it to work unlike some reviews here. i booted up the game after installing the dlc and it just worked right away.

So far i had 1 game crash in the games editor. but none during gameplay.

The game itself is awesome and looks and feels way better than trials HD or evolution, The dlc is awesome, and u kinda need it because every user created track uses the DLC. I love creating tracks and installing the dlc will give u way more props to work with in the editor. 
overall i give it a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300531304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1686968489}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060776875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 81000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60936, 'last_played': 1616964804}
review: This has to be one of my favourite games. Though I don't care much for racing or motorcross style games, this one is so rewarding to play. As grounded as the game is it doesn't take itself serously, and everything in it exists for fun, not simulation. There is no skill ceiling and infinate replayablity thanks to the regular community maps made in the games increadible editor, which can let you make just about anything, and to the standard of any ingame track or even above it. There are some minor bugs but nothing that disturbs gameplay, and I believe the season pass gives more than enough content to justify it, though mabye not so much for the unicorn DLC. My only complaint would be it's cross platform implementation, which doesn't allow crossplatform multiplayer, and tracks created on other platforms show as 'Fusion Shared' meaning you can't find more tracks from that creator.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967088329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1677722925}
review:
I recently came back top this game because I was craving some trials action and I was reminded at just how ass the game was.  Both the levels and the setting aren't as good as Evolution.  The trick system feels crappily tacked on and is required for most of the challenges on the maps.

Then to top it off the game is packed to the brim with DLC that isn't even that great.  I'd recommend just going back and playing Evolution over purchasing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027022331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1702855428}
review:
Whilst I like this game, one of Uplay's updates has nullified all my progress. After tracking down exactly what it did (took my old profile save and changed the extension to a .old file) no amount of tweaking things back to how they were fixed it.

The worst part is that it somehow still remembers all of my old replays.


0/10 -- last game I buy with Ufail attached

review: I love the Trials series so it pains me to see all of the horrible things Ubisoft has done to a once great franchise.  Uplay is required to play it, but thats not even the biggest issue.  The biggest issue is the dlc.  This game is 20$ guys, the season pass is 20$.  Why does the season pass cost AS MUCH as the game itself?  This is a huge rip off and its not worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070835936', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1494799979}
review: I didn't they could mess up a trials game, but then again this is ubisoft we're talking about. After paying $20 dollars for the game it almost feels like I installed the game for free with the microtransactions that are hinted at as soon as you enter the game (acorns). 90% of the player made maps require DLC so you can expect to throw 40 bucks or so into this game before you really start getting hours out of it. And this game just will not work AT ALL on keyboard. It goes full throttle and there's no alternate control buttons so I am physically stuck on a level until I fix my xbox controller. I'm really disappointed, I loved evo :,(

author: {'steamid': '76561198356501112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3611, 'last_played': 1495942199}
review:
Quite a good game Trials Fusion, unlike my other review, this was much better. Basically, all you do is race tracks, there's different modes you can do and you can race with your friends.

Leaning is near impossible to get right when you first start, most tracks, I cannot even finish because of the leaning problem but character/bike customization are available so gives the game a really high rating, and you can choose between a male and female rider. Most tracks are futuristic.

Trials Fusion, unless your pro, this is only really a game to play with friends, it can get really frustrating so best to look at tutorial videos of the basic to advanced controls and tips before attempting to purchase this game for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975701227', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1494376647}
review:
[h1]Just. Frickin'. Do. The. Frickin'. Bunny. Frickin'. Hop. [/h1]

This game? Don't buy it. There's zero difficulty settings to help peoplelikeus (me) and the control mechanism is horrible. 

You'd think that, at some point, your rider might actually want to situate themselves in the middle of the bike, like how they start off. No. Once you've leaned either way, that's it. Which basically screws everything.

[b]Obviously[/b] I'm not very good ... but hey ... perhaps give some help to the notsogoods out there. I'm definitely going to cheat this game, because screw this game.

There's absolutely no brakes, just forward and backwards. Now maybe that's how trials bikes are made ... but this is a game. I would screw on a bloody brake onto the damnable thing!

There are people who don't need the hardest game in the world, it doesn't hurt to put options in for those people. Seriously. Someone that wants to take it hard (*cough*) can do that all they like.

Also this thing [b]never[/b] connects to uPlay after the first few times. I tested FARCRY 4 straight afterwards to be sure, and sure enough that worked.

Seriously screw this game. Violently.

Casual games should be casual ... this really isn't that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228190424', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1444, 'last_played': 1573134013}
review:
A great new entry in the line of [b]Trials[/b] games.

A unique and addictive mix of puzzle, physics and racing; which RedLynx has been mastering for what must be a decade now. I've been playing the RedLynx trials games since waaay back when they were just 2D Flash games; so they've come a looong way.

However - I ride a motorcycle daily, still do trials biking on my bicycle, and have ridden actual Trials motorcycles, and I actually prefer the handling of it's predecessor: [i]"Trials Evolution"[/i].

[h1]PROS[/h1]
The prettiest graphics of any Trials game to date; with fantastic gameplay to match.

There's a wide range of beautiful environments and props for you to not only race in, but also create your own tracks in (with a bewildering amount of customisation). Your rides and riders can be personalised too, with (most) items being unlocked with progress and paid for with the in-game currency you earn. The rider can now do tricks in midair (once you unlock them) for that extra XP and show(off)manship. Tracks are varied, clever and engaging. And for those hardcore completionists, there's three side achievements for every track which range from simple to-dos to entire minigames. Lots of extra fun and value. Oh, and in case you didn't know, there are also Online and Local multiplayer modes too.

[h1]CONS[/h1]
Handling that can be hard to understand and predict.

I will say, the bikes move at a more realistic pace than ever before, feeling like they have real weight an inertia. But hit a bump or land from a drop, and sometimes those physics go out the window with a bike that surges and bounces like a space hopper, or jams/judders in a way that seems to stall the bike. Evolution had a bit of this too, but it made sense as the bikes felt light and twitchy. But when a hefty bike does it, it's hard to react, and harder to counter (the heavier bikes mean less airborne control). Performance also struggles too - The game isn't overly complicated, but it seems quite demanding on CPU and GPU power for what you get.

[h1]OVERALL[/h1]
A great time wasting and skill honing game for people of all ages and gaming levels. Definitely worth buying if you see it on sale, but you may as well skip Steam and get in from uPlay directly (as you have to use uPlay anyway). However, if you're rig isn't very powerful, you'd be better served getting Trials Evolution - it's just as much fun, and probably better value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084821058', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1652945374}
review:
Two main points.
1. I hate that this uses Uplay
2. I absolutely love this game.

Uplay can be a hassle to deal with, but its nothing compared to how great this game is. The controls are super smooth with a game pad (once you get used to the game physics) and the game itself is gorgeous. I was worried the scenes might get boring and redundant, but the devs did a fantastic job at keeping things fresh. While most levels are an off the center third person view, almost looking over the shoulder, some levels are unique in their views such as the sunrise level (which looks stunning). In addition, I've found some cool easter eggs as well. Wonderful game, but could do without Uplay. Totally worth buying. Seriously. Do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102759119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1682, 'last_played': 1474848894}
review:
Although the physics and controls in Trials Fusion remain as good as they are in in previous titles; the whole game feels uninspired and unimaginative when compared to trials evolution. Sure FMX is now a thing and some may like that, but the entire theme of the game is future and nothing but future So after 60 or so tracks they all start to blur into one big yet slightly different track. I'd be fine with this if the tracks flowed nicely but they just aren't fun or challenging. Except the ninja tracks maybe but they verge closer to irritating rather than of more finely tuned Inferno III of days past. 

Perhaps if you're new to the series this game would be excellent, but after many hundreds of hours on Evolution I couldnt say the same. (Xbox 360 version)

Tl;dr The game feels rushed. Pushed out quickly to make money without forsight into what made the last two games fun. Buy Trials evolution gold edition. A game made before Ubisoft fully dug their claws into Redlynx. Never go full Ubisoft.

review: Nach mittlerweile knapp 100 Spielstunden kann ich nichts anderes behaupten au√üer, dass das Spiel extrem viel Spa√ü macht. Durch seine Dynamik, den DLC's sowie durch die aktive Community ist das Spiel extrem abwechslungsreich und spannend. Zudem ist es extrem einsteigerfreundlich (ist mein erstes Trials), sodass man sich gut in die Mechaniken und in die Steuerung einarbeiten kann. Das einzige, was ich manchmal zu bem√§ngeln habe ist die Ladezeit von den Ger√§ten. Ansonsten kann ich es nicht anders sagen, als das ich jedem, der Spa√ü an Renn- und Geschicklichkeitsspielen dieses weiterempfehlen w√ºrde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075533794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1486850353}
review:
Die ersten 3/4 des Spiels haben nichts mit Trials zu tun- es spielt sich wie ein Handy-Spiel bei dem man nur auswendig lernen muss bei welchem Sprung man wie weit springen darf. Erst sehr Sp√§t im Spiel bekommt man langsamere anspruchsvollere Strecken- kurz danach ist das Spiel vorbei und mehr als die H√§lfte des ausw√§hlbaren Inhalts ist DLC.

Die 3 zus√§tzlichen Herausforderungen, die es in jedem Level gibt sind eigentlich eine gute Idee- allerdings sind viele davon einfach nur nerfig.

Die Strecken sind zwar optisch sehr detailreich aber die ganzen Explosionen, Naturkatastrophen und Effekte machen das Gameplay nicht besser und st√∂ren eigentlich nur. Mehr anst√§ndige Level mit weniger Dekoration w√§re mir lieber.

Grunds√§tzlich scheint das Spiel besser zu laufen als seine Vorg√§nger- allerdings sind die Ladezeiten deutlich l√§nger und die Motorr√§der im Auswahlmen√º brauchen so lange bis sie erscheinen, dass ich erst nach Stunden zuf√§llig gemerkt habe das es sich nicht nur um ein Text-Men√º handelt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001053552', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1494341679}
review:
Great difficulty and nice futuristic theme. Nonetheless, the motorcycles do not feel very futuristic.

+infuriating difficulty
+different behavior of the motorcycles match different level layouts
+deep control system with emphasis on leaning the right way and breaking or accelerating at the right time; much deeper than those browser games
+local multiplayer, sadly way more simplistic and uninspired than the single player levels

-uplay
-sometimes it is not very clear whenever a jump is a success or not because jumping often needs a special sequence of leaning inputs in a short ammount of time
-stunt/trick system controls a bit wobbly as sometimes inputs are not accepted because of fast spinning (does that count as realism?)
-game gets harder with your controller having a big deadzone. I cannot recommend Logitech devices
-annoying menu design as it takes away from the futuristic theme and tries to sell you DLC all the time
-game throws you out of a level if you need to many retries, erasing your checkpoint progress

All in all i can recommend this game despite it being an Ubisoft game. It is really fun after you finally are ingame and out of the disgusting and irritating menu screen.
Keep in mind that this is the darksouls of motorcycle games so prepare to die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046311355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1570518357}
review:
Trials Fusion has quietly become something of a minor masterpiece. With the normal content plus season pass and MAX DLC there are a pile of things to do in the game, and it should keep any player busy for at least a solid 40 hours. We haven't even touched the 20k plus community tracks. From the active online through to campaign and whatever else you need, there really isn't any way you could go wrong with the MAX edition, which includes all the DLC plus the new MAX stuff for 40 bucks. This will obviously drop in price on certain sales. I honestly have very few complaints at this point in time. So let's discuss a few things:

A lot of the cranky reviews cite either Uplay or the newest DLC, released long after a the yearly season pass, as problems that make them feel angry and mad. Neither of these issues is even the slightest bit of a problem anymore. If Uplay is not running correctly for you in 2015 it's your own fault. I have absolutely zero problems with it and haven't had any major problems with it for well over a year. It's a solid service, if unneeded, and really it doesn't belong in reviews for this game anymore.

The season pass has expired. It was never meant to be a free DLC for life kind of thing. Only an idiot would keep thinking that a season pass somehow connotates free DLC for life. The new content is suitably priced anyway. Taken as a whole there are literally no problems with this game. At its release I could definitely agree it was a little lighter on content and the price was too expensive for not having a functional multiplayer; as well it was buggy and unfinished. But that simply is not the case anymore. Everything you would ever need is now included in the game, but polished to a high degree.

The unlocks are decent and the various bike upgrades and ability to change colors and wheels among other things is a nice feature to keep you busy. There are a decent amount of extras for those interested that kind of stuff. You can use acorns, the new currency, to buy special additions like new body styles, outfits, and faces. You also unlock a decent amount of stuff just from normal playtime with the original currency. Acorns currency can now be purchased for cash if choose to do so. Leveling up in game seems to grant a decent amount of acorns as well.

The meat of the game I am very happy to say is very solid. Graphics have been given a large boost and it shows throughout the incredibly varied environments. With the season pass you have access to a multitude of different locales and each has its own vibe that is fairly unique. As far as comparing this to Evolution Gold well this one is a lot different. Fusion is more extreme, with the themes of the environments and tracks taking on a totally appreciated craziness that really never lets you down. Both games are worth owning.

Evolution is more grounded, where as this one just goes for glory and throws in some very imaginitive and well-constructed tracks that take you from the fiery pits of hell to the most futuristic skyscrapers of an advanced civilization. And everything in between. There is no game that does racing quite like the Trials series, and the devs have seriously stepped up their game.

There are the usual medals to earn, but there is also three achievements on each stage that can find you hunting down squirrels or activating secret switches for special achievements. These will keep a lot of people busy that have gotten their golds the first couple times through.

Besides getting gold medals, the idea is that you may want to try and compete on the leaderboards. Cracking a top 5K time will definitely give you the challenge you need and should entertain the skill levels of all players. Add in some wonderful multplayer action and dozens of hours will pass before you get tired of this one.

I run this in 4K with a single 970 on the highest settings and it mostly holds a stable 60FPS. A few drops here and there on certain courses. It's a beauty of a game for sure. It might have some nitpicks here and there, but for the most part no Trials game has ever looked even close to this lovely.

All in all this is now a great game. Support for Fusion continues and multiplayer is still very active. So get on it. It's worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059295301', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 22768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18174, 'last_played': 1700712812}
review:
Trials Fusion is a fantastic game of realistic futuristic bike riding, Ride in many trials and even select between male or female! Perform crazy stunts and flips with over 6 bikes to choose! Customize your bikes with new body kits, wheels and color! Even customize the look of your rider with new outfits and colors. Unlock the mystery of the chilling Trials Fusion story as you follow it from beginning to end. In the After The Incident DLC, the story is fully explained in the first two tracks. Create your own tracks in the new track editor and share them with others for others to rate. In real life, many do not know this but before the game was made, the producers of the game made actual treasures hidden around the world to find and at first, no one knew about it and some of the treasure has been found. Look up the story on wiki to find out more! And all the DLC tracks are awesome, recommend getting all of them!

It's like playing a comedy and it's absolutely hilarious to watch for the viewers, this game will get you hooked! Do get the orignal trials fusion with the season pass, then you don't have to get each DLC separetely.

5/5

Game Rating: PG (Mild Violence)

Genre: Racing

RELEASE DATE: 25 Apr, 2014


If anyone wants to do multi together sometime, my Uplay username is Surviva777 to search for me. You can invite friends too! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998314646', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1621462224}
review:
[h1]En r√©sum√©[/h1]

Un jeu diablement fun, dans la veine de ses pr√©decesseurs. Il ne leur apporte pas grand-chose de plus, d'ailleurs... si ce n'est une nouvelle occasion de d√©penser plein d'argent dans des DLC, des cascades anecdotiques, un look assez futuriste, et un √©diteur encore plus abouti.


[b]Graphismes[/b] : Les textures sont assez moyennes, pour ne pas dire grossi√®res, les explosions sont assez laides. Le jeu ne brille pas par ses prestations graphiques, bien que les effets de lumi√®re soient assez plaisant ; mais l√† n'est pas sa pr√©tention, cependant, et le tout est parfaitement acceptable pour ce type de jeux. [b]3/5[/b]

[b]Synopsis[/b] : [spoiler] Un mec sur une moto traverse des pistes [/spoiler] [b]N/A[/b]

[b]Gameplay[/b] : Le jeu se laisse manier avec une certaine facilit√©, h√©ritier de la tradition tr√®s ancr√©e d√©sormais, explosion des smartphone oblige (#Note7), du "[i]easy to learn, hard to master[/i]". Plus pr√©cis√©ment, si les motos se laissent assez ais√©ment dompter (√† diff√©rents degr√©s selon votre choix, il est vrai) et ont du r√©pondant, cela n'emp√™che pas le jeu de se montrer parfois tr√®s ardu. J'en ai mang√© ma manette. Bref, un sans faute dans son genre pour ma part, aussi perfectionn√© (si ce n'est plus) que ses pr√©decesseurs. Nouveaut√© pas franchement notable mentionn√©e plus haut : la possibilit√© de faire des cascades dans les airs, que je n'ai pas trouv√©e vraiment int√©ressante, surtout en tenant compte des mini-jeux pr√©sents depuis Trials HD, dont la majorit√© sont bien plus amusants que cette feature. [b]4/5[/b]

[b]Dur√©e de vie[/b] : Si la "campagne" n'est pas franchement longue (finie en quelques heures pour un joueur de Trials aguerri), surtout sans les DLC, la possibilit√© de cr√©er et t√©l√©charger des niveaux multiplie le contenu, et rend le jeu interminable, pourvu que l'on soit capable de d√©nicher les petits chef d'oeuvres qu'il nous faut parmi le contenu propos√©. Un mauvais point √† ce propos : une connexion Internet est obligatoire pour jouer sur les pistes des utilisateurs, m√™me quand on les a d√©j√† t√©l√©charg√©es. Par ailleurs, la faute √† un manque d'innovations dans le gameplay, les habitu√©s, √† moins d'√™tre vraiment fans, auront vite fait de se lasser. [b]4/5[/b]

[b]Bande-son[/b] : Les cris du pilote sont toujours aussi dr√¥les, les bolides toujours aussi insupportables √† entendre. Pas de toute, c'est du Trial. Mention sp√©ciale √† la commentatrice-robot qui parle de temps √† autres en arri√®re-plan, et dont on se serait franchement bien pass√©e tant elle enl√®ve plus qu'elle apporte √† l'ambiance sonore. [b]2/5[/b]


Peu de nouveaut√©s sous le soleil avec ce Trials, qui semble n'√™tre qu'un pr√©texte pour porter la franchise sur les consoles next-gen... et en sous-exploitant de fa√ßon assez ironique leurs possibilit√©s. [i]We go to the future...[/i]
Bref, du bon Trials, reserv√©s aux grands fans pr√™ts √† d√©bourser bien comme il faut (le contenu hors DLC est mis√©rable), ou aux d√©butants de la franchise, qui seront sans doute, comme beaucoup avant eux, s√©duits et amus√©s. En ce qui me concerne, la satisfaction que m'avaient apport√© le premier titre sur PC, et Evolution (qui √©tait franchement sympa), n'ont pas √©t√© franchement au rendez-vous. Le jeu reste, encore une fois, assez fun, mais la sauce futur n'a pas pris ; n'a pas justifi√© l'achat.


[h1]13/20[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039620263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8840, 'last_played': 1436087080}
review:
This was a great franchise that got absolutely destroyed by Ubisoft and Uplay.  Honestly, still a great game to pick up if you just want to play single player or custom tracks alone.  Multiplayer, however, is non-existant on PC.  There's just simply no one on, because they rushed it out the door without MP and didn't add it for a year, and by that time the game was dead already.  They made sure they rushed out those DLC's, though.  

Also, don't buy the DLC.  You get infinite content through the community hub.

I played and bought all the DLC's from all the previous Trials games, but supporting Ubisoft's destruction of a beloved franchise just isn't good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994440800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1582903176}
review:
It's Trials. If you enjoy previous games you will enjoy this.
It starts easy enough for anyone to understand and learn the basics. And when the game isnt challenging enough for you the community takes over and provides you with maps ranging from "fun" to impossible. The editor is amzing for what it is. You can create anything you want really.

I see a lot of people having problems with CTD and such, so far I have not had any issues at all. Maybe I'm one of the lucky few. I can only write a review based on my on experience, not what others have reported, and so far I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978662694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1468605574}
review:
The game is not as good as the first titles. They took the old core concept and slaugthered it: You have to pay real money for optical upgrades like this is a free to play title. The season pass needs to be seperately activated within uplay (another software/account for gaming) and does not include the last DLC they released (WTF IS A SEASON THEN?!?) and the local coop (the games selling point imho) is worse than the previous titles (less tracks,less player made tracks). 

i strongly recommend to NOT buy this!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061757575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1467298226}
review:
It always really bugs me when people low-ball the ratings for things because it didn't work for them. 
But in this case I think the technical issues are bad enough to be a non-starter. To clarify, the underlying game is a blast, from what I played, but to get 25 minutes of gameplay I had to put in about 3 hours of troubleshooting across two different (and very normal) computers, a PC and a laptop. There's a solid mix of server problems (uPlay AND another Ubisoft connection, both of which can, and for me did, fail often) which immediately reset your saved progress (it's always-online), graphics problems, and start up problems; all persistent across both computers. More irritating, the demo worked fine after a bit of work, and the full game did not: the demo uses uPlay but seems to save itself a lot of trouble by not attaching your progress to your account.

I love the hell out of trials. But this game is hard enough to even start playing to make me wary of any future uPlay thing. It's more headache than the fun is worth.

review:
WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

Bought this as it was cheap in trhe Summer Sale and I own and love the game on my PS4, big mistake. 

As if it wasn't awkward enough to try and run in the first place (thank you Ubisoft, I totally wanted UPlay), it then crashed every time I tried to progress beyond the start menu, and every 'fix' I found online didn't work. 

So after racking up a tidy 0.4 hours play time just on the main screen, I decided it just wasn't worth the hassle and requested a refund.

review:
I bought Trials Fusion when it came on sale a week after I first tried my first Trials game (Trials Evolution Gold). It was a pleasant upgrade in graphics and gameplay and I am quite in love with this game. It has a range of levels across many beautiful vistas. I enjoy the skill games that throw some extra spice into the regular levels. The difficulty of those levels scales nicely from pretty easy (even for someone who is not particularly familiar with this style of game) all the way up to the excruciatingly difficult and playing with mates is better than it ever was. Hitting those jumps perfectly can be amazingly satisfying.

A+, I love this game, buy it now.

Pros:
1.	Hundreds of free tracks online
2.	A range of difficulties to suit everybody
3.	Online and local multiplayer (I am talking split screen!)
4.	In game track builder
5.	Character/Bike customization and unlockables
6.	Sweet sweet Trials game play
7.	Best Trials graphics to date

Cons:
1.	None come to mind, BUY THIS GAME

author: {'steamid': '76561198175464763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1461629391}
review:
Honestly, Trials is such an amazing, well made game. Up to par graphics, runs well, tracks are really well made (both by Red Lynx and community), and it is kind of a step up from Trials Evolution. Even the DLC's and that ultra max pack update/DLC made this game pretty great.
My only problem is effin Uplay. I recommend the game, and if somehow you get the Uplay gods to like you, then you're golden (unless you're like me and you do something to anger the gods, then Uplay breaks your game entirely).
All in all, great game, but bad platform. It really should have been run through Steam and not have Uplay be its launcher.

review:
Good game.

I've played these type of games since I was a kid and this one is definitely one of my biggest favorite games ever. It's also a masterpiece which works well for both, veteran players as well as for complete beginners. Gamepad is recommended though to get the best experience and control of the bike which also makes it easier to complete the hardest tracks. This game got great graphics, enjoyable music, a lot of challenging tracks and most importantly ridiculously good and responsive gameplay controls, so if you fail it is always just your own fault. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198190782562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1693795370}
review:
A mi parecer Trials Fusion y la serie Trials en general son muy buenos juegos. En especial lo que me gusta del Fusion es que se trata de un juego muy fresco visualmente, lo que destaca es el arte conceptual, en lo personal me gusta mucho como implementaron el trasfondo de este juego en un ambiente futurista con muchos misterios, cada pista es visualmente muy atractiva. 
Ahora bien, en cuanto a la jugabilidad el juego es genial, tanto si usas el teclado como si usas un control el juego se puede jugar perfectamente bien, cada zona tiene niveles de todas las dificultades, aunque los niveles extremos suelen ser exactamente como su nombre lo indica y aunque juegues durante mucho tiempo  te sera dificil manejar al 100% la moto como para hacer los movimientos necesarios en esas pistas, esto hace que quieras seguir jugando hasta terminarte la pista para poder ver la peque√±a y curiosa cinematica del final de cada carrera. 

Algo que me parece un plus para este tipo de juegos es el hecho de poder crear tus propias pistas y compartirlas con la comunidad, lo cual le da una vida muy larga al juego. Ya van casi 3 a√±os desde que salio este juego y aun se suben cientos de pistas nuevas credadas por usuarios. 

Posiblemente el unico pero que tiene el juego es que el multijugador no funciona como deberia, comunmente hay muy pocos jugadores y los tiempos de espera son largos, sin embargo no me parece que el juego se haya dise√±ado para multiplayer, de cualquier forma esta ahi y se agradece, pero en lo personal no es algo tan indispensable.
Otro peque√±o detalle (y no es algo de que preocuparse) son los peque√±os bugs que puede llegar a tener el juego en situaciones puntuales, como cuando caes con la moto desde una altura muy alta algunas veces el personaje atravieza la moto y se queda inmovil, lo que te hara reiniciar la pista.

La banda sonora esta muy bien lograda y a√±ade dinamismo y ambientacion a las pistas, y con el narrador y la IA diciendo cosas que te dan una idea de lo que sucedio y te hacen imaginar la historia es algo que lograron crear a la perfeccion.

Sin duda es un juego que vale la pena por su gran cantidad de contenido y por su equilibrado precio, seguramente obtendrad muchisimas horas de diversion con este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079525781', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 9525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6186, 'last_played': 1677766673}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987442221', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4135, 'last_played': 1648845608}
review:
One of my most played games. has some lovely improvements over trials evolution with regards to the handling of the bikes... the learning curve is brilliant and lets you increase your skill cap without making you hit walls outright.. that being said the Extreme tracks are the point where the game makes you either get better or start pulling your hair out.

the courses are well designed with only 1 or 2 tracks that I didn't like to play, mostly because of the forced quad use... 

the track editor is awesome with endless possibilities,..more so if you have the DLC...and multiplayer is downright hilarious at times....

10/10 would buy again even though it's Uplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049670371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6405, 'last_played': 1693550038}
review:
I have owned this game for 2 years now and I have played it on and off. I have been waiting to write this review since the I purchased Trials Fusion. I have now put 103 hours into Trials Fusion and I can finally say I have 100% completed the career. The emotional roller coaster I experienced while playing this game is unfathomable. Anger, joy, sadness. etc. the list continues for more words than are in my vocabulary. I'm sure that by this point my blood pressure is that of a 87 year old chain smoker, yet I don't mind. The satisfaction from completing a level or even improving a previous record is such an enlightening feeling. The rage and hatred that was once there is replaced by an abundance of good emotions. You battle no one but yourself, it is all a battle of your own skill. It takes away from the competitive nature of so many games and brings you back to the basics of what a game should be, frustrating beyond belief but satisfying. Red Lynx has done an amazing job putting together Trials Fusion and I could not be happier with the game. 
10/10 Buy this game!

review: This was my first ever mainstream trials game, alongside it's sister game, Trials Frontier. They are both extremely well planned and executed. They both have tracks that you'll want to tear your hair out over but they're all worth it. The DLC bring great new story elements and help tie the two games together. I recommend this game, all of its DLC, and the free mobile game, Trials Frontier.

review: I just wanted to help restore balance to this game's reviews. I personally think it's great. I know it's expensive if you buy the DLC as well; I know it encourages you to spend real money in order to buy in-game items; but you can actually play for at least 18 hours without having to spend a penny. That's not bad, especially at sale price. The game-play itself is excellent, well balanced (literally), endlessly enjoyable. I think I'm going to be playing it for a long time to come. Buy it if you like racing games or platformers - this game scratches both itches for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961961642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1457835451}
review:
I got this as part of the arcade pack a while ago, and kinda forgot about it.  Today I felt in the mood, having played some Trials HD back in the day.

I start it up, and FIRST THING, it takes me to dlc.  It literally shows the menu where you'd pick levels, and automatically scrolls over to the paid content.  If I hadn't gone searching in disbelief, I could easily have been fooled into thinking that this game contains no career "on-disc", so to speak.

Once i figured that out, I was puzzled that I'd gone and downloaded a free-to-play game without realizing.  It even has premium currency and expects you to buy outfits (which are also listed before the ones the game comes with).

Everything about this screams money-grubbing, consumer-hating, can't-find-our-butts-with-both-hands-and-a-flashlight corporate stupidity.  I feel like I paid someone to spit in my face.

Maybe the rest of the game is good, but I have no idea.  I'll never play it again.  There's a hell of a lot more game out there that actualy, you know, COME WITH THE GAME IN THEM.

Ubi's gonna have to something pretty damn amazing to get me to install their pathetic U-play BS again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098637630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1456451967}
review:
Fun and frustration in the same sentence... that's what Trials Fusion does. 

Graphics are neat and sharp. Gameplay is fantastic albeit frustrating at times. But gets old quick, nothing too gripping to keep me hooked. 

I did have issues with Ubisoft but somehow after working through the initial setup, I'm going okay now (touchwood).

Bottomline: Buy $5 or less

author: {'steamid': '76561197983347089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 36019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19529, 'last_played': 1636884726}
review:
Have you ever wanted to ride a motorbike inside a volcano? Or maybe in outer space, inside a glitching computer jumping between computer and reality, a toxic waste dump, climb a mountain during a blizzard. Maybe ride a tattooed unicorn with a purple mohawk being ridden by a bandana wearing cat holding a pistol sending you any place you can imagine.
This game is freakin awesome, the visuals are eye candy its a game of skill thats easy to learn and difficult to master, at the time i wite this the community has over 88,000 maps available to play and you yourself can release your creativity and make a track of your own. Daily competitions for varing rewards, every map in the campaign has 3 challenges to complete that are so random and unrelated to riding you will be asking wtf but in a good way. And personally i have had almost no technical issues with the game, once in a rare while the game freezes but alt ctrl delete and restart fix it every time. To sum it up, so much fun so much to do so much to conquer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155208988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1594, 'last_played': 1518745877}
review: I've loved trials for a long time and the game itself is good, not really great. The game wasent finished when released. The game is only a fraction of the content, after they released all the dlc. You might want the rest so you buy the season pass... But wait you missed some content because there is more dlc that is not included in the season pass.. so we got the game, got the season pass, and the extra dlc and we're good to go.. right? no? ahhh microtrasactions! because a rayman costum is totally worth real money. What else could they add to piss us off. how about having to download a 3rd party program just to play the game. Uplay is usless, it just make the process take longer and just annoys people. fusion is a great example of the direction ubisoft is heading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113527065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1468423532}
review:
although i'm giving this game a negative review, i gotta say that i love this game, my problem is that everything about this game that makes me love it, existed in trials evolution, this one didn't bring anything new in my eyes.
and honestly, i would give this game a positive review if it weren't for the bullshit that they did with the online tracks.
so now, you can see every single track on the track market, even the ones that require additional content, so now i can't play like 99% of the market tracks because they all include additional content, plus they are pushing additional content in your face a lot in this game.
TL;DR nothing better than the first game, DLC making 99% of tracks on the market unavailable, annoying AF.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000077393', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4919, 'last_played': 1452460105}
review:
Trials Fusion is a perfect time killer because you'll be playing and retrying all the tracks multiple times to get the best times. Thanks to the great bike physics this series is known for, the game is the very definition of ‚Äúeasy to learn, hard to master‚Äù and ‚Äútrial and error‚Äù. So it requires a certain degree skill to fully enjoy but in my opinion it is extremely satisfying to see yourself getting better and beating that one hard track you've been stuck for so long.

The game is not without it's problems: Uplay is mandatory and still a piece of sh*t that nobody wants, micro-transactions (luckily only for cosmetics), DLCs are pretty expensive for the amount of content they offer (best get them on sale), multiplayer is dead due to being added really late paired with PC having lowest audience for Trials games and also a controller is required because keyboard controls are next to useless.

Many Trials veterans say that Evolution is better and more worth playing over Fusion for various reasons and they're probably right but I wouldn't know since I never got into Evolution when it came out on PC. The futuristic setting, electronic music and the ambiguous hidden story of Fusion was more interesting to me than bland old warehouses in a desert valley accompanied by rock music...

But I'm in the minority who cares about that stuff so this review is simply from a Trials noob who enjoy the game for what it is despite it's faults :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198087312354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1451796426}
review: Initial opinion, upon opening the game it failed multiple times to connect to ubisoft while my connection was fine.  After it made it into the game it immediately took me to where i can purchase more DLC when I was starting it for the first time to play it.  Maybe i'm  tired of all the games pushing DLC but there's something real annoying about a game that opens for the first time not with a cool intro movie or walk through but straight to the store page to sell you more.  I'll add more as i continue to play the game but controls seem to respond poorly.

review:
Je joue √† "Trials" depuis le HD sur Xbox 360, j'adore ce jeu et son principe d'infinit√© de courses, son √©diteur de map super bien foutu, une physique g√©niale, une r√©elle sensation de progression, bref c'est un chef d'oeuvre. 

Mais plusieurs gros points n√©gatifs sont √† retenir:

‚Ä¢ C'est un jeu Ubisoft: Ai-je besoin de d√©velopper ?
‚Ä¢ Le mode multi √† √©t√© oubli√© sur PC: Impossibilit√© de jouer en multi pour un jeu sorti en 2014. Je n'sais m√™me pas s'il est d√©sormais disponible..
‚Ä¢ Des packs et encore des packs de tout sublim√© par un soup√ßon de packs: Ce genre de dirreciton me fout la gerbe comme √† beaucoup de gamers et "Trials" se suicide en devenant une vulgaire pompe √† fric comme tant d'autres.
‚Ä¢ Le FMX est impos√©: Alors ok pour le fun, mais √ßa m'emerde de devoir faire du FMX pour avoir la platine partout en Extreme par exemple: t'es √† fond dans ton trial et on vient te couper avec du FMX que t'aurais aim√© voir dans les mini-jeux ou encore dans une cat√©gorie exclusivement r√©serv√© √† √ßa.

Tout √ßa pour dire que rapoort qualit√© prix, rien ne vaut les anciens opus.

Uninstalled out of boredom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023631416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1464909488}
review:
i think it's pretty damn crappy that you can buy the season pass and yet they still withold content from you. although, admittedly, said content is pretty f'ing stupid. and i only know this because the awesome max edition was on, like 80% discount for a very short time when it came out, so i bought it for one of my other pc's.

other than that, it's an ok game, i guess. worthwhile at 75% discounted price. notwithstanding that, i advise against purchasing this game because there's an unbelievable amount of recycling in the race courses.

and, quite naturally, this game, which the customer pays for outright, has been infected with the dreaded microtransactions which were supposed to be reserved strictly for the free2play business model. very, F'ing, shady.

also, i unlocked almost everything in this game in about fifteen hours of play.

Red Lynx has sold their souls to ubisoft and i won't be giving them any more of my money.

in case you feel the urge to contradict me on any of these points, don't waste your time, i'm not here for conversation. 

this section was provided for me by steam to state my opinion and i won't stand for anyone to come here and offer me their review of my review.
so, you can keep your critiques to yourselves and simply move along.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155306525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6980, 'last_played': 1516836119}
review: Game has held my interest for 2 reasons, soon to be just 1. First off this game Trials Fusion is like a stretched out version of Trials Evolution which is a way better Trials Instalment. The online gaming feature is only leaderboard competion's. You wont find anybody to play with and if you do it's just the  two of you. good luck also if the connection stays long enough to finish the 4 seperate tracks you usually play people against. I have to say that they really dropped a butload of fecies onto the Trials franchise with this instalment. Most interesting part of the game is the Creator Mode. That has been my top reason for coming back to Trials Fusion. Second reason is 2 Extreme rated tracks I have not yet completed.  Game is not worth whatever they sell it for, unless it's $5.00 for the whole game and DLC Season Crap and whatever all in one. Should be made into a free to play game.  - 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198114254506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2040, 'last_played': 1608399044}
review:
So here's the thing;

If you're a massive trials fan (As I am) you are probably going to buy this game because it's trials. However for it's price it is not worth it at all, the only redeeming features of this game are the user generated tracks (which are great) and it looks pretty (clutching at straws now).

If you want a great trials game buy Trials Evolution because that's where the series peaked. 

Also, damn Ubisoft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086455926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 9538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 1482381405}
review:
as much as I love the the Trials series, I can't recommend this game to people. I'll play the living hell out of it because I'm obsessed with the series, but it takes a very specific kind of person to really squeeze 50 dollars of play value out of this (base game + all DLC).

Ubisoft really did some damage to the series and this game hardly stands well against previous games in the series. I still believe Trials HD is the best in the series, but that's more a personal opinion. I would recommend checking out the previous game, Trials Evolution Gold Edition, rather than settling on Fusion. Although the multiplayer is still rather empty, it's still a more down-to-earth title that keeps a lot of the aesthetics that make the Trials series so great. Plus it has way more tracks in the base game than Fusion does.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968788420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1477136385}
review:
Buying this game is like dating.

Date One: She's Kinda fun. Bit pricey, doesn't hang around long.
Date Two : She tells you she wants to get serious. (Better fork out for season pass).
Date Three : She tells you she is not ready to commit (Better buy some newly added suprise dlc to keep her happy)
Date Four : She tells you she wants to see other people (reduces price for everyone else)
Date Five : Wants to get married, and take half your income. (adds microtransactions)

Edit: One year later:
You try to reconnect to her. But she hangs up on you. (Uplay servers won't connect anymore).

author: {'steamid': '76561198119161893', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 4491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3796, 'last_played': 1617244103}
review:
Wonderful game.

 The map editor crashes every time I use it. No fixes, no replies to my emails. 

Why is it that the AAA Companies are always the ones to give unfinished garbage, while the devs that bring games out in Early Access and have less resources are the ones to actually try to imporve their game? The logic there doesn't make sense, but when you have hundreds of kids who don't care about company values, you get crap game after crap game, because they know these kids will buy it no matter what. You could feed these kids shit and you just have to call it McDonalds and they'll eat it right up. 

I recommend the game, just not the editor. Again, Steam NEEDS a midway option. Too many games get stuck on the edge because it's either  a yes or a no.

review: DO. NOT. GET. THIS. GAME! #1 My game refuses to go into full screen mode even after trying multiple different things that usually work: restarting my computer, re downloading the game, and trying to just launch it off of uplay. #2 The game randomly caps out at 30 fps until I fault or restart on a track, even when i have it set to 60 fps. #3 The game randomly pauses and cuts out audio for 10 seconds or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081978226', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5489, 'last_played': 1534999553}
review:
This game had good potential, but ubisoft ruined it. I loved trials evolution and was anticipating this game because of it. At release I was very disappointed to find out there was NO online multiplayer. It took ubisoft around a month to finally listen to the community and release the multiplayer.
In evlolution the custom maps were a blast making the game last forever, but in this one any DLC prop/part in a cusotme track requires you to have that DLC. So basically you need the season pass to play very many custom tracks. After paying for DLC which should never be in any game ever becuse paying for the rest of the game after you already bought it is bullsh*t. Ubisoft decided to release more DLC that ISN'T COVERED BY THE SEASON PASS. That is infuriating especially when they put in, in game transactions. After paying 20 for the game and 20 for the season pass which is reciculous becausericiculous because it is the same price as the game, and 10 for the other DLC that isn't included in the SEASON PASS. Now they want you to pay real money for fake money in the game that should be earned. In game transactions shouldn't be in any game that you have already dropped 20 dollars on plus 30 for the rest of the game. This is a new low ubisoft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055319056', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 4698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2392, 'last_played': 1705422939}
review:
So das ist jetzt die aktuelle Fassung meiner Review da ich jetzt meinen Rechner gewechselt habe.

Dieses St√ºck Software welches auf den Namen "Trials Fusion" h√∂rt,macht sehr viel Spa√ü und die Grafik ist meiner Meinung nach Bombe. Zwar ist das "etwas" futurristische Aussehen Geschmackssache aber mich hat es angesprochen,Nein, angeschrien :P

Das Spiel ist mit UPlay verkn√ºpft was bedeutet das wir auch dort die Zeiten unserer Freunde ansehen und schlagen k√∂nnen. Z√§hneknirschende Kopf an Kopfrennen sind Vorprogrammiert.

Mir pers√∂hnlich macht dieses Spiel sehr viel Spa√ü und selbst die DLC¬¥s (Ich besitze zurzeit Empire of the Sky) machen derzeit sehr viel Spa√ü und laden zum Wiederholten Rekordebrechen ein.

Die vielen und relativ abwechslungsreichen Gebiete sind sehr gut Designt und beeinhalten auch das ein oder andere Easteregg und bringt somit sehr viel spa√ü beim erkunden mit sich. 

Desweiteren wird man immer dazu angespornt seine Pers√∂hnliche Bestzeit in den Asphalt bzw in den Stein zu brennen.

Das Spiel besitzt zu dem auch noch einen Leveleditor der es uns erm√∂glicht unsere eigenen Strecken kreieren und mit der ganzen Welt teilen zu k√∂nnen. Nun zur Bewertung

Grafik: 10/10
Spa√ü: 9,5/10
Streckendesign: 8/10
Schwierigkeits-Level: Mittel

Schlusswort: Klare Kaufemphelung bei einem Vollpreis von 19,99. Sehr gutes Spa√üiges Rennspiel was man auch mit Freunden zocken kann.

Hoffe euch hat das Review gefallen

Gru√ü
ExtremeChan

review:
Like so much that Ubisoft touch at the moment, this game is ruined by crazy levels of in game purchases for things we once got for free... and the annoyance I am having even activating the DLC I have purchased, correctly. I guess Uplay has something to do with it all.

After entering the product codes, the game tells me I have purchased all DLC, yet clicking on any of these items takes me to the store page via the steam overlay, suggesting I need to buy it, GRR.

The bug ruining Zombi was bad enough, forcing me to sit and wait in the vain hope it gets fixed, but this is a step too far. I am hoping it isn't too late for a refund should my cry for help go unanswered.

The game seems ok aside from this, but I have to warn others of the possibility of endless messages on forums.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029141167', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1555452311}
review:
this game is capable of rendering a good 60fps on a mid-range gfx card with all visual settings on maximum.

but many people complain of poor performance.

for whatever reason, this game insists on launching in [b]borderless windowed mode[/b]. regardless of your previous settings, this game always launches in [b]borderless windowed mode[/b].

while running the game in borderless windowed mode, you will notice that the game loses vsync capability and it appears to revert to 30fps for unknown reasons.

so, for most folks, the cure for poor performance in this game should be as simple as this:

at any point after you launch the game go to your keyboard, hold the [b]alt[/b] key and press the [b]enter[/b] key and the game will go into fullscreen mode and your framerate issues should disappear instantly on any mid-range gpu. (assuming the rest of your computer isn't a fu pos).

you may thank me if you wish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069895517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1445379379}
review: When I began, I enjoyed this game. Cool, really atmospheric tracks with some tricky jumps and spots that made me feel accomplished when I got over them. One level in the desert world Is entirely silhouetted with a beautiful orange sunset in the back. It was a great game to throw on some headphones, listen to music, and zone out to. Then, I hit the hard levels and the difficulty seemed to spike without warning. It became less of zoning out with a few interesting and well designed challenges to jumps you could only just barely make that didn't give you any satisfaction to finish. And then the extreme worlds. They're fucking wretched. At this point, the game stops being clever with its design and just relies on its extremely imprecise controls to simulate difficulty, to a rage inducing point. Its simply not fun. I can't reccomend this game, as you will find yourself getting more and more upset with the controls. Why would you make bunny hop, a very crucial skill later in the game, such an imprecise trick? 75% of the time I tried to bunny hop it resulted in flinging myself into an unwanted front or backflip. I'm sorry, but you can't fall back on shitty controls to act like your game is super tough rewarding experience. Save yourself the rage and frustration, and look elsewhere. Also, Uplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119938754', 'num_games_owned': 1052, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 5348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1683565058}
review:
Yes it has Uplay but I don`t see what the big deal is. Just copy paste the sn and you are good to go. Whatever the glitches were, they have been patched. 

This game is beast, looks gorgeous, runs smooth with everything maxed out on my 280+. U can switch between mouse, keyboard and controller without hickups, check your email while the game runs in the background and pops right back up when u give the command. It`s all good. 

Sure, I`m more of a purist and don`t care too much for the futuristic look but the core game is there and it is fun. I bought the max edition during discount and have no regrets, would try 100+ times again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042396875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1676750623}
review:
The game itself is good. But they make you launch it through their Uplay launcher. For some reason when clicking on the Trials Fusion play button, the game opens up in the background but doesnt actually open. Then, if you try and play it again it has an error message saying 'Failed to start game (app already running)'. The app isnt fucking running is it because I would be playing it if it was. 
I've tried finding a solution for this problem online and it has been going on since 2013 and yet ubisoft are not fixing it at all. I have played the game once and it was fun but every time I've tried opening it since then I've encountered this problem along with a lot of other people over a number of years. Poor customer service, and the most frustrating thing ever when you've paid for a game but it wont even fucking open.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980206308', 'num_games_owned': 3968, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1499192512}
review:
It could be a good game... Not the best one, but good. But it's not even good. Because Ubisoft.
Uplay? Check.
Microtransactions? Check.
Season pass that don't include all DLCs? Check.
Multiplayer that was added after all DLCs? Check. Most players just moved on already.
Also the game has much worse optimisation than Trials Evolution, a lot less stable and so on. Just be aware that you might not be able to launch it at all because reasons.

The main problem is that Trials Fusion isn't exactly the most creative game... It's just another sequel just like Ubisoft likes it - bland unispiring game with exactly the same visuals and gameplay with a bunch of gimmicks and extensive marketing campaign on top.

Trials Evolution was just better game overall. It was just that - complete package without gimmicks, a really great and all round polished game in which developers cleary put their love and soul. And Trials Fusion is just a second-rate game that only exists to get your money, Ubi-business as always.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985820308', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1430738213}
review:
While my hours are low here I have it also on Xbox One and have played through most content there. 

Awesome game! 

It is a great addition to the Trials series. I have played every game in the Trials lineup and love them all - this is no exception with the same gameplay feel but better graphics and more insanity!

You won't get 1000's of hours out of it like you might from an MMO but its definitely worth the money if you want a game that is easy to pick up and play for 10 minutes or a few hours.

The only downside is it really does benefit from a controller so I would recommend playing with one instead of a keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038421720', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1437289142}
review:
Bought both base game and Season pass, liked the base game, loved the premise of a game that would get worked upon as time went on.

Every DLC has been pretty shoddy, not a whole lot of content, then finally one of them caught my eye (Awesome Level Max).

Man, was I pissed off to find out the one thing that would bring me back to the game was behind a new paywall, because RedLynx came up with a new definition of Season Pass, more focused on the Season than the Pass. Not spending another buck in this game, recommend that you avoid it too, this is everything that's wrong with the industry.

Oh, and it has microtransactions too.

I'd played Urban Trial Freestyle and I loved it, so I was hoping this one would work just as well. 
The controls are atrocious by comparison. It was basically unplayable after being used to such a superior game. Plus you have to use Ubisoft's annoying game launcher UPlay to even play it.
If you want the game you thought this would be, go here: http://store.steampowered.com/app/243450
Ubisoft just can't do anything right anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065104803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1974, 'last_played': 1547325265}
review:
MULTIPLAYER IS DEAD

 My NAT type is strict and did everything possible to fix it. Nothing worked. Even the port forwarding pointed out by Ubisoft.

 Also I was able to find 3 matches out of 10, and it takes about 2mins for the search to end. All matches included the same 2 players everytime (i guess big fans who keep playing anyway.

The singleplayer is good IF you include the season pass, otherwise the fun will end shortly. And the fact that  you have nobody to compete with is a shame.

Overall bummer. I think they waited too long with the multiplayer so nobody came back for it.

:(

author: {'steamid': '76561198025320554', 'num_games_owned': 921, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1502343121}
review:
In my opinion this game stands on its own as a Trials game, but there are a few things that I hate about it and force me to not recommend it. First up is Uplay. Everyone hates Uplay. 

There are never any players online, so there goes that whole section of gameplay... there's never anybody to play with.

The DLC is just a huge money grab. The game by itself doesn't have enough content to justify the $19.99 price tag. I paid it and expected a lot... I got a little with the offer to pay more to get tracks that should have come with the game. That extra $19.99 for the season pass seems steep, because it is. $40 for a "complete" game that doesn't have much depth or the replayability of the older Trials games is a rip off. If the DLC (which should have come with the game anyways) was included in the original price, I would be more apt to recommend it.

Screw Ubisoft for being so greedy, and for forcing Uplay on the innocent.

review:
I recommend Trials Fusion and I also own and recommend Trials Evoloution Gold Edition. Both are great games, I'm not a fan of Uplay., but for me, these games were worth jumping through hoops to play them. They have easy, medium and hard tracks and hard means hard, but they also have user created tracks, so there is plenty of tracks to play. I bought the Season Pass and the game together on sale and there is plenty of content, I'm not sure how much included game content there would be without the seasons pass though. 

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198106385316', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1473652959}
review:
This recommendation was a tough call. I ended up choosing no for some very key things in the game that just made it painful to play. But first the pros.

>Good theme, like, they couldn't have done it better. The blend between nature and technology was blended perfectly and it does feel like it is part of a bigger universe.
>Nice controls (more on that).
>Frankly great graphics (again, more on that later).
>Good menus.

And now the cons. In the cons I will not be discussing Uplay. The DRM does cost you a few minutes in the beginning and (for other games) can be a huge pain. However, in this game, all you need to do is log in once when you first boot it up and it doesn't really bug you much after that.

So, cons

>For someone with a lower-end machine, this game will kill you. As I said, great graphics, but what it did to me was reduce the framerate down to almost nothing and made the game almost unplayable due to button lag. My pc isn't terrible, either. It can play almost all games above 60fps and only goes this low for games like Next Car Game (which is an excellent game), and even for that it still gets 15-20fps.
>Multiplayer is a pain, unlike the previous ones where it was a huge part of the experience.
>Lack of content, which other people have commented on.
>"Season pass," which is required to add what content the game should have had in the begining. Plus DLC, which I am generally against unless it's something like the gods and kings expansion pack. Basically, its just Ubisoft being Ubisoft.

And thats pretty much it. If you are someone who has seen trials videos and wants to get in on it, pick Trials Evolution Gold Edition. It is better in most ways and equal when it isn't. If you have been a fan of the trials series ever since it started, go on right ahead. The main con for me is circumstantial, so if you are really dedicated you can have fun with the game despite the other flaws.

Edit: Forgot about the "More on controls." Basically the only thing that I was going to say on that was that the game implemented a trick system that really doesn't contribute to the game at all. A few challenges may use it but most of the time it just gets in the way, especially during the tutorial levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999667170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13348, 'last_played': 1518568264}
review:
So, after reading alot of reviews of the Trials series and this game in particular, i feel obligated to write one on my own.

Many people had a huge problem with Ubisoft and their way to market their games, in fact those people hate on Trials Fusion just because it uses Uplay. The game is published by Ubisoft, i do not know why you would think they wouldnt put it on their own PC distribution service and account control service. 
Yes Uplay is sometimes broken, but those times are not THAT often, it happens  here and there, and Ubisoft doesnt seem to give a shit. But really, i dont want to review the Publisher or the Developers, which both chose to run this game on the platform.
The Game Itself:
- a very skillbased "racing" game, where the point is more or less to drive through a track with no mistakes, only after that the time really matters
- has alot of content (though the price with the DLC is pretty high, compared to a triple a title it matches though)
-> User created content pushes the game forward to a pretty high replay value (which mostly explains my playtime)
Most negative aspects about it:
- lack of content of the original game (no dlcs) compared to evolution
- no ways of communication directly through the game
- the multiplayer is pretty lagged out (though it is much better than evolution)

Overall, they needed too long for the game to be at this state (which is a pretty definitve version on how a trials game needs to feel like), it felt like a beta for about a year into it. The developers did not abandon the game though and continued to give (free) content for the players to enjoy. With this in mind, i can only say it is one of my most beloved games today, for its high skillcap and active community, which still produces some great quality tracks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971562434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1520839048}
review:
Buy fusion if you have never played these games.

I hadn't played them before so I had no tie to any- I got gold edition on xbox and fusion on pc and like Fusion Way More. 

Evolution is just a bunch of old wooden planks, but I found fusion to be very crisp, diverse, and colorful. 

Although I hate Uplay, I had no issues with this one.

review:
I played hundreds of hours of the previous games on Xbox so I am a fan of the games. Fusion is fun and challenging in the same way that HD and Evo were. Having to run Uplay is a bit annoying but it starts up automatically so it's not that bad.

There are some frame rate issues occasionally but I guess that is just from running on PC where other things are happening in the background. Restarting Fusion seems to fix it mostly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137060842', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1529869362}
review:
So, let me start by saying why is uplay such a big deal? the game runs flawlessly on my computer. uplay hasnt failed me once, and neither has trials fusion. Npw, i know people feel as if this is a terrible game, but, i find it very amusing. i like the graphics, and i really like the courses. trials fusion is the successor to trials evolution, witch may people like far better. havin never played evolution (which i will buy the gold edition) i wouldnt really know. but i am not to crazy over the futuristic idea of it, but it definitely captures the core gameplay of the trials series. the gameplay is deceptively simple.
you have to drive your bike down a sidescrolling track and balance yourself by shifting your riders weight left and right.
the game is 2.5d meaning that you are on a 2d track, but the rendering is 3d. you can only go forwards and backwards, but trials has such an addicting nature that you keep playing. overall 9/10
