author: {'steamid': '76561197976418610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 9208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1653590154}
review:
If you liked Trials Evolution, then there's plenty to love here.  I've seen some complaints that the game is light on single-player content, and while it does seem pretty lean, you have to remember that Trials Evolution Gold Edition is actually a combination of two games in one, so it should have substantial more content.  Then you have the DLC, which I have yet to play or purchase, and it is disappointing that the content wasn't included in the main game.  I'm sure I'll buy the DLC eventually but I'll wait for it to go on sale.

The gameplay is much the same as its predecessors, but the UI and game progression feels more modernized with the level-up system and the addition of level challenges in the single player career mode.  Of course there's the addition of trick courses added to the arsenal, which are kind of fun but still not as much as the main game.

The environments and feel of the levels are a big change from Evolution, as Fusion sticks with a more futuristic setting.  It's a little more unnatural, but I appreciate them mixing things up, and I have to say that the environments have a ton of detail and are really pleasing to the eye.  The addition of Portal-esque humor between two robot AI characters kind of falls flat, but I still really appreciate the constant slapstick of your character rag-dolling at an end-of-level hazard.

Uplay is still there, but it's a non-issue.  It's never crashed my game, and I haven't had performance issues.  I also can't speak to the user-content or multiplayer as I've yet to touch it.  The core of the game remains intact, though, and there remains little more in all of gaming as satisfying as passing a seemingly impossible level in the Trials series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029708120', 'num_games_owned': 1208, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1709658835}
review:
Sale edit: Every DLC is on sale right now, this hasn't happened before, so take the very low price into account with my DLC reviews :)

Awesome level MAX Edit: This isn't included in the season pass, and as yet I do not own it. I'll update this section with details on whether the DLC is worth a full price or not when I purchase it for myself. As for the introduced microtransactions, they're purely cosmetic and not required.

[h1][b]Introduction[/b][/h1]

This was the first Trials game I ever played, and it's great. Don't let the negative reviews put you off, most of them are negative simply because it uses Uplay, which I shall talk about further down the review.

[h1][b]Setting[/b][/h1]

First off, the environment in this game is stunning. For a game like Trials, in which you just ride your bike across level after level, you wouldn't expect this level of quality, the world looks like it's part of a much larger game. There's also plenty of variety, as you quickly move from the futuristic city to platforms in the sky, ancient ruins, outdoor courses, underwater bases and even the planet's core. There is also some slight hints of story included through a few characters talking throughout the game, which hint at how the world became like this.

[b][h1] Gameplay [/h1][/b]
It's trials. You drive your bike, tilt your weight and try to make it to the end as fast as possible and with as few failures as possible. Every level also has three challenges that encourage you to play differently, and some even involve minigames entirely different to how the game is usually played. The difficulty as you pass through the levels is done very well. By the time I was met with much harder obstacles, I'd already got a basic idea of how to surpass them, and not once did a death feel cheap.

[b][h1]DLC[/h1][/b]
The DLCs add some nice extra content that also gives you a look at more of the world of Fusion, and provide some decent challenge. I wouldn't recommend buying them seperately, but if you don't want to buy the Deluxe Edition, here's a summary of their content and quality:
[b]2/10/15 Edit: Read the Deluxe Edition section for my opinion on prices![/b]

[b] Riders of the Rustlands [/b]
The first DLC and the weakest. Featuring only 6 levels, an FMX course and a mediocre minigame. - [strike]Not really worth ¬£4 compared to the other DLCs, skip this one and get another.[/strike]

[b] Empire of the Sky [/b]
Same as above, 6 levels, FMX and a minigame. The levels are a bit better than Rustlands, [strike]but still not worth ¬£4. If you've beat the game and want some more fun, get this DLC. Otherwise you can ignore it.[/strike]

[b] Welcome to the Abyss [/b]
Breaks the chain and includes 8 levels instead of 6, as well as the FMX and minigame at the end. This DLC gives an interesting look at an underwater empire that used to live under the ocean. Some story is delivered through another AI who speaks to you at certain points. The levels are of a higher standard than the first two DLCs,[strike] and I think barely justifies its ¬£4 pricetag.[/strike]

[b] Fire in the deep [/b]
9 levels, FMX and a minigame. In this DLC you are even further down, underneath the planet's core. As you move from level to level you go further underground, giving a nice indication of your progress through the DLC. There are also multiple secret recordings hidden around the levels, which give some extra information about the world, and what went on in the mines.[strike] Worth it.[/strike]

[b] Fault One Zero [/b]
Personally, I believe this is the best DLC. It drops one level and returns to 8 trials again, but the quality of the levels steps up greatly. This DLC has a focus on technology, much more so than previously shown, with teleporters, anti gravity machines and Mechs featuring. The levels in this DLC are very inventive, including [spoiler] one that repeatedly glitches between looking normal, and a blue cyberspace-esque environment[/spoiler] and [spoiler] an interesting level in which you drive around inside three arcade machines![/spoiler][strike] This DLC is definitely worth ¬£4.[/strike]

[b] After the Incident [/b]
The sixth and final DLC. Same as above, 8 levels with an FMX and Minigame. One of my main disapointments with Trials Fusion was the lack of detail as to what was happening. I understand that this is a game solely based on a random guy riding a bike through obstacle courses, but with such an interesting world, with many deeper story elements hinted at throughout, I really wanted to learn more. After the Incident does so nicely. It's set in the future, when all the world is in ruins after the aforementioned "Incident". The levels all focus on fairly different areas, all destroyed or going through some form of crisis. Similar to Fire in the Deep, you can find secrets in the levels, which give you some backstory as to how all of this started. The way this is done is great, as [spoiler] SynDI talks to you through a dating game text box, with amusing exagerated changes in her expression as she talks.[/spoiler] If you want to know more about the world behind Fusion, or just want to play even more levels, [strike]this DLC is worth the money.[/strike]

[b] Deluxe Edition [/b]
[strike] I'd like to point out that this game has gone on multiple sales, but not a single time have the DLC packs gone on discount themselves, and it doesn't look like they will at any time unfortunately.[/strike] [b]--In the most recent sale at the time of writing, all DLCs aside from Awesome Level MAX have been reduced to 99p, so I'd definitely recommend waiting for a sale before purchasing any DLCs--[/b] As such, I highly recommend you get the Deluxe edition during a sale, I managed to pick it up for ¬£10. Otherwise, if you beat the game and decide you want more, you will be paying a much higher price. Say you got the base game on sale for ¬£6. Now if you got three of the DLCs, that'll cost you an extra ¬£12. Half the DLC total DLC and you've spent ¬£18 already. The Deluxe edition is a much better purchase (During a sale of course. The DLC is good but not worth ¬£30!)

[b][h1]Why the negative reviews?[/h1][/b]
Now, there are three main flaws that have gave this game so many negative reviews. First main point is the multiplayer. I played the game entirely solo and had fun, I can't really comment on it.
Secondly, people seem to be complaining about this being a bad port, and having a many performance issues. For reference, I ran the game on an i5 3570k, 8gb RAM and a GTX 770 with constant 60fps and no issues of any kind. The issue may be related to lower-end machines.
And as for the last point, UPlay. The majority of these reviews are from people starting the game, seeing Uplay, closing it and leaving a bad review. I will say right here that if you avoid this game because of Uplay, you are stupid.

[b][h1] But UPlay sucks! [/h1][/b]
The impact of UPlay is nowhere near as bad as the reviews make it sound. You start the game on Steam, UPlay appears, takes a couple seconds to log in, then minimizes and starts the game. You only need to interact with it once in order to create an account, and after that you don't need to touch the thing, aside from closing it when you are done.

EDIT: UPlay now does not even appear when you start a game through Steam. It minimizes itself. Seriously guys, the impact is so minimal it's not even worth arguing about!

[b][h1]Conclusion[/h1][/b]
All in all, I recommend Trials Fusion to anyone who is an existing trials fan, or enjoys 2D games with high difficulty. Though the price is a little steep for the content on offer, so I'd suggest waiting for a sale and getting the deluxe edition. As earlier stated, it's much better value as the DLCs never get discounted, and only costed ¬£4 (the price of a single DLC) more than the normal pack in the latest sale. And finally, do not avoid this game because of UPlay, there is no reason to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151183304', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1527348315}
review:
Aaaah Trials Fusion, je l'attendais beaucoup car j'ai ador√© Evolutions.
Graphiquement, le jeu est vraiment joli (peut etre trop pour un jeu arcade de Trials, ou l'on a besoin de fluidit√©), la lumi√®re est bien g√©rer, les ambiances des courses sont agr√©able.
Malgr√© certaine texture bugu√©/moche, le jeu est globalement beau.
Le gameplay est pour moi beaucoup plus lourd que sur Evo, j'ai eu l'impression de piloter des engins lunaire tellement certaine moto (uniquement 6 au passage, c'est vraiment pas beaucoup) sont grosses.
Mis a part sa, rien ne change ou presque avec l'ajout des figures qui sont gadget a mon sens.
Gros point n√©gatif pour la dur√©e de vie, il m'a fallu 3h30 pour atteindre les pistes extremes, c'est vraiment tr√®s peu.
Quand au piste extreme, ce sont les seules pistes difficiles.
La bande son du jeu est simple, efficace, colle parfaitement l'ambiance, en √©tant pr√©sent et discret.

Au final Fusion est un jeu sympa, mais bien trop court et avec un gameplay trop lourd pour moi, j'ai vraiment √©t√© d√©√ßu du jeu.
Je pr√©f√®re largement Evolution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223008056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1459589814}
review:
Das spiel ist ja nicht schlecht, finde aber den preis √ºbertrieben. Aber wenn das spiel im Angebot ist, k√∂nnte es sich lohnen.

Pros:
- gute Grafikk
- custom maps
- online mehrspieler

cons:

author: {'steamid': '76561198008265381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1431124632}
review: Having liked this genre of games in the past.. I really went in wanting to like this game. From the onset it looked like similar games, such as trial evolution, etc.. but much more massive in scale. Well, it is massive... that is for sure. It has tons of tracks, content, and multiplayer.. but along the way it lost it's fun, challenge, and excitement and ends up being a poor reproduction of a classic. Whereas in previous games, you could mess up and still not crash, or choose your path, etc.. this game is exteremly linear.. a do it this way or die pattern quickly emerges. That ruins all the fun and charm of the previous games. So after a few basic levels.. you start getting it.. and once you realize it is.. ok.. do this now.. then do this. ok now this.. it becomes boring and bland. Save your money and pick up trials evolution or one of the other ones.. as this one, try as it might, is actually the worst of the lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994542612', 'num_games_owned': 1772, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1609878526}
review:
This game is great because it provides a great balance between fun and challenge. The game allows for continuing without getting a Gold or Silver medal, only a Bronze. So if a particular level gets to be too frustrating you can continue on to the next level and then revisit it.

The flip side, though, is that once you finish a level and haven't received Gold you feel very compelled to retry, which is great for adding re-playability. 

I haven't played through completely yet, or any of the DLC but so far I'm enjoying it more than the previous Trials games which I liked as well.

There are a few levels that are difficult, mostly because the challenges are unclear. That's about the only time you can blame the game for the frustration it induces. One level in particular is the most searched variant of Trials Fusion, Trials Fusion Big Air. I completed the level with Gold after looking up how others did it for some instructions, but I'm not convinced I could do it again.

Odd levels aside I'd definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055288144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1555702018}
review:
Erstmal m√∂chte ich das positive erw√§hnen.
- Gute Grafik
- Tolle Welten
Das √ºbliche halt, wenn man an Ubisoft denkt.
ABER 
da ist ja noch das negative...
- Steuerung ist mist, egal ob Tastatur oder Gamepad
- Verhalten der Fahrzeuge ist teils unberechenbar
W√§hrend des Spiels lernt man immer mehr Tricks und Fahrmann√∂ver.
Leider haben sich die Programmierer wohl nie zeigen lassen, wie ein Trial Motorrad und die Tricks wirklich funktionieren.
Es spielt sich eher wie ein Motorrad Jump & Run. Was nicht unbedingt schlecht ist, aber anders als erwartet.

Fazit:
Wem soll dieses Spiel nun gefallen?
- Motorradfans werden sich √ºber die Physik √§rgern....
- Arcade-Gamer wohl √ºber den Schwierigkeitsgrad
- Alle √ºber die Steuerung
Es Macht ja spa√ü am Anfang, aber irgendwann ist man nur noch frustriert, weil man mit zig mal Checkpointladen nur noch Bronze bekommt, und man keine neuen Welten mehr freibekommt. Da hilft das DLC schon sehr, weil man noch ein paar leichtere Strecken hat, um Medaillen anzusammeln, aber am Ende ist es einfach nur noch Frust.... Vor allem da halt das Springen und das Bremsen nicht richtig funktionieren.

Hoffe das hilft etwas weiter.
Wer mehr als 15 ‚Ç¨ inkl. DLC bezahlt, wurde ehrlichgesagt ausgenommen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987499858', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1431146644}
review:
I was suprised this game had mixed reviews when I first picked it up, as I loved the Trials Series and didn't see how this game was that different. 

Gameplay wise, it's the same old game you know and love, with the ability to pull off some sweet tricks if you're good enough. A lot of people don't like the futuristic level design of this game, and while I agree it is very different from the previous titles, I actually liked this take on it. The level design is some of the best I've seen, there was clearly a lot of work put into making the stages beautiful and it payed off. 

Overall, this is a really fun game, either by yourself or with friends! Would definitely recommend picking up the game + dlc/season pass when it is on sale, as you get a lot of extra content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067389027', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 22811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22125, 'last_played': 1672502798}
review:
[UPDATE 18-03-2016]

Pour pr√©senter rapidement (pour ceux qui ne connaissent pas), Trials Fusion est le dernier n√© de la s√©rie des Trials, licence o√π l'on joue basiquement un motard qui doit aller d'un point A √† un point B en suivant une ligne de course en 2D. La force de la licence r√©side dans la simplicit√© de sa prise en main (position pilote, vitesse de la moto) alli√©e √† la profondeur de son gameplay (une palette √©norme de techniques √† ma√Ætriser pour faire p√©ter les chronos). Le coeur du fun r√©sidant bien s√ªr dans un moteur physique hors du commun, jouissif au possible. Bref un jeu de plateforme / adresse tr√®s bien pens√© et addictif au possible. Ajoutez √† √ßa un √©diteur de niveaux tr√®s complet, des graphismes tr√®s jolis et un multijoueur sympa et vous obtenez une cr√®me.

Pour ce Fusion les petits gars de chez Redlynx se sont m√™me fendus d'un pseudo sc√©nario sympathique histoire de donner un fil rouge √† tout √ßa, et qui en plus cr√©√© un petit lien rigolo avec Trials Frontier, l'√©pisode smarphone sorti en m√™me temps (excellent aussi, au passage). Des d√©fis ont √©galement √©t√© ajout√©s (3 par piste) : parfois b√™tes, parfois hardcores, mais souvent amusants, ils apportent une nouvelle mani√®re de voir une piste : exploration, handicap de jeu... 

Alors pourquoi est-il si mal not√© ?

Ne vous fiez pas au "Variable" du r√©sum√© des Evaluations, il est d√ª au fait que le jeu a eu pas mal de soucis lors de son lancement et a d√©√ßu beaucoup de joueurs fans de Trials Evolution (le pr√©c√©dent opus), qui n'aimaient pas trop l'univers futuriste (visuel et sonore) de Fusion, √©taient exasp√©r√©s par les bugs, fustigeaient le manque de multi et ne pardonnaient pas les petites maladresses qui parsemaient le jeu. On a beaucoup critiqu√© aussi le manque de classement cross-platform (360, One, PS4 et PC) alors qu'ils l'avaient plus ou moins promis. Sans parler du mode FMX (figures) ajout√© un peu √† l'arrache et loin de faire l'unanimit√© (figures un peu hasardeuses √† sortir). La r√©putation d'un jeu se faisant le premier mois, les gens ne sont pas revenus poster apr√®s un an. 

Mais qu'en est-il un an plus tard, justement ? 

Le jeu a corrig√© pas mal de ses faiblesses : 
- Le nombre de bugs a chut√© (mais la "roue qui accroche" est encore perceptible),
- Le multi est sorti,
- Les DLCs ont donn√© beaucoup de vari√©t√© dans les ambiances et dans les objets de l'√©diteur de niveau. De plus ils sont globalement tr√®s bons en ce qui concerne les lignes de course, tr√®s agr√©ables √† parcourir. Les 6 DLC ont doubl√© le contenu du jeu de base.
- Une cat√©gorie Ninja est apparue sur le Central des Pistes (celles cr√©√©es par la communaut√©). La difficult√© Ninja d√©signe l'ensemble des pistes tr√®s hardcores cr√©√©es par les joueurs depuis Trials HD, que RedLynx reconna√Æt enfin officiellement sur Fusion. Une tr√®s bonne nouvelle pour les pratiquants de cette discipline.
- CENTRAL DES PISTES DEVENU CROSSPLATFORM : le fantasme de millions de joueurs enfin assouvi ! Manque plus qu'un classement commun et on sera bon !
- Mise en place des √©quipes.
- Volont√© de la part de Redlynx de faire vivre le jeu : tournois avec lots de screens, de speedruns et de cr√©ation de pistes, mise en avant des cr√©ateurs, streamings, et maintenant une licorne.
- Le retour des drapeaux dans les classements pour voir la nationalit√© des joueurs : je dis oui !

Aujourd'hui m√™me si le coeur du jeu est toujours l√† (physique, √©diteur, fun) et est toujours excellent, Fusion reste tout de m√™me bourr√© de petites choses pas si importantes que √ßa, mais qui bout √† bout donnent une petite impression de regression parfois : 
- Moins de customisation (motos + tenues) compar√© √† Evolution,
- Impossibilit√© de voir un replay directement depuis une piste contrairement √† Evo,
- Impossibilit√© de faire un retour arri√®re sur un replay (√ßa on l'attend depuis toujours),
- Disparition des rivaux compar√© √† Evo (c'√©tait une id√©e tr√®s chouette pourtant), 
- Disparition des tournois fixes, apparitions de tournois ponctuels qui changent tous les jours/semaines/mois.
- Impossible de t√©l√©charger une piste du central (compar√© √† Evo) : jeu en streaming. 
- Classement impossible des pistes du Central compar√© √† Evo, √ßa devient vite le bordel dans la liste.
- Manque un peu de petits objets dans l'√©diteur (compar√© √† Evo).
- [EDIT] Les micro transactions dans le DLC Awesome, m√™me si purement cosm√©tiques : je consid√®re que dans un jeu pay√© plein pot, c'est non.


Donc en r√©sum√© : 

+ La physique
+ La prise en main
+ La richesse du gameplay
+ L'√©diteur de niveaux 
+ Central des Pistes (et sa cat√©gorie ninja) (ET SON CROSSPLATFORM !)
+ Multijoueur local & online
+ Fil rouge rigolo
+ les d√©fis
+ Mode FMX qui varie les plaisirs
+ DLC qualitativement tr√®s riches
+ Le retour des drapeaux

- DLC quantitativement tr√®s chiches (compar√© √† Evo, o√π 2 DLC faisaient autant que 6 pour Fusion)
- Glitch de la "roue qui accroche" encore un peu trop pr√©sent
- Mode FMX qui √©nerve
- Classement par plateforme
- Customisation en retrait (compar√© √† Evo)
- Interface globale en retrait (compar√© √† Evo)
- Microtransactions

Trials Evolution restera LE Trials dans le coeur des fans, mais il n'emp√™che que Fusion reste objectivement un Trials tr√®s solide.

review:

Update: I liked the original game better then the DLC. The DLC had more difficult tracks then easy and moderate tracks. I recommend playing through first installment and skip the DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044220947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1443815211}
review:
Do yourself a favour and Ignore all the negative reviews on this game and all the whinging on its Uplay integration (which makes no difference at all). There is no such thing as a bad Trials game! It works fine online AND offline, the classic core gameplay is unchanged, there are a few new additions of course such as the FMX stunt courses and the futuristic theme which I see no problem with.

All its a solid title and a successful sequal to Evolution Gold not to be ignored. (just make sure you turn off the in-game music/commentators at the start, they get a little irritating...) 

Also If you can afford to get the season pass as well then I recommend you do so, the more content the better!

author: {'steamid': '76561198118576714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 13537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5779, 'last_played': 1550556928}
review:
WARNING I HAVE HORIBLE SPELLING IGNORE THIS POST IF YOU ARE GOING TO SPAM CORRECTOINS.
Not bad but sadly far from good compared to what it was this is actually worse than hd
This is coming from a long term fan that has actually been following the companys work since they released a flash trails game yes i know thats sad
as soon as they were baught by ubisoft i lost trust in the company and i still hold distrust to this day

Trails hd was simply amazing it was alll about riding skill games were about riding there was no bull shit and the game felt completley diffrent

Sadly the pc port was horrible and the gold editoin hd is nothing like the real thing
 Evo was a step fowards fun and enjoyable

Then youtube ruined it youtubers like pewdiepie ksi and other idiots played the game the main complaint was 
The game is to hard and yet it was actually easire than hd by a long shot 

Then this game released dumbed down for the masses
i still enjoy the game however it has forced story forced fx shitty gimic system 
the main thing this game dose that i love is add challenges some of which have mroe time spent on them than the actual level itself! i love this game despite the big fuck you it has been to lovers of their prevouis games i have actually gotton worse instead of improving because they have made the game so dumbed down everything is easir to do 
Just make harder levels you say?
Its still not the same play hd on the xbox 360 (if you have played both you will know why the gold editoin dosent compare) then you will see what i mean 

Value for money this is perfect yet as a long time fan this is a big f u big time slap in the face to vans
the so called added multiplayer isnt even proper multiplayer its a shitty supercross map there is also no point in playing the games like there was in evo 

that was why i waited then the game was on sale for a price so low i couldnt not buy it

Lots of there loyal audince has left and i know why its dumbed down for the masses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041396549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1490555815}
review:
I've been a fan of the Trials series for a few years now, but I always run into the same problem. I literary fly through all the easy and medium levels, but when I start the hard ones, the game's just over for me. I have to spend hours to get one done, and have use too many checkpoints. 
Easy and medium levels I get done in one go most of the times, all gold medals, but the leap to hard is just too much for me.

That being said, the game looks amazing and the futuristic style is wonderful.
The addition of the tricks didn't feel all that great to me. I like the idea of it, but the excecution can be worked on. Or maybe it's my controller, I don't know.
Adding the skill levels at the end of every chapter was new to me, too, and fun! But a lot of times it's hard to understand what they want you to do or the learning curve is to steap. I had a hard time getting trough the one where you had to do tricks before you hit the ground. My rider was flying around like a rag doll, getting stuck on every part of the bike.
The ATV's look great, but don't use them online! They're horrible to jump with. It's just the raw power you use them  for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982430346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1546285616}
review:
Overall, the game is entertaining,  especially up to the hard levels. It is a pretty fun game to just start up and play for a little bit and you can quit whenever. For me, however, the extreme levels take the challenge overboard into a realm of not being fun anymore.  

+Lots of tracks and you can download even more
+Graphics are good
+Lots of different environments
+You can get lucky, but it requires a lot of skill 

-The extreme levels are so hard you want to punch babies
-The trick system that you use for the trick levels....amazingly bad controls.  
-UPlay and DLC Season Pass

Overall 6/10.  Get it when it's on sale and it's pretty good value.

review: I think the game is fantastic on its own, but if you can buy it on a console, do it. Terrible PC support, very few answers in forums. Bad framerate issues even with high end PC, some tracks worse than others creating progressively worse issues the longer you play the map, while others run fine. After 20 hours of play, I can't even launch the game anymore, and I can't find anything anywhere to help resolve the issue. I've tried re-installing, rebooting computer, you name it, no go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052729415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1426880553}
review:
I am heartily disappointed with this game. The previous two Trials games were great; full of content, great level design, simple but effective layout/gameplay/difficulty levels. 

Trials Fusion offers an infuriatingly bad soundtrack, a forced 'story' and setting, an SSX style 'tricks' dealy that is hardly utilised, a redundant multiplayer mode etc etc

Not to mention the fact that the game is largely hidden behind a season pass paywall. That means ¬£32 for all of the content. Most of which is probably terrible. 

What a load of paywall bull***t! 

Also: Uplay. 

Thanks for nothing Ubisoft and associated sell-outs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011647032', 'num_games_owned': 12448, 'num_reviews': 868, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1578904426}
review: An excellent game that is great for casual to hardcore gamers. A great challenge all around. Its great to play with friends. The levels vary from easy to hard. Some levels you have to go full throttle through the whole thing to not die. The mechanics and physics in the game is amazing and well done. It does take some time to get used to how to move and stuff. Its great to play around with friends and see how you stack up against them. Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979682873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1521079110}
review: Tried the original and thought this would be more of the samem which is something completely deceptive from its appeearance. Most people would assume that it's some racing game about motorcycles but this is not at all the case. It's a physics-based puzzle trial system based on balance and speed control through some really tricky tracks. The whole dirtbike thing is kind of incidental as it's just a vehicle that works for the system. As you progress, these tracks get more and more tricky requiring ever increasing amounts of control. Great game all around but was not expecting Fusion to be as robust a game is it is. Amazing graphics and sound which is a gigantic leap over the original, and it has a soundtrack so good that you can't but to pump it up and groove to it. Really well optimized and a totally pure "video game".

author: {'steamid': '76561198011859644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1452612769}
review:
Let me start by saying this game is actually really fun. The problem I have with it, is that it will not boot. It just crashes as soon as it tries to load. Well done Ubisoft, you have made another game which does not work on pc. 

I had to edit the graphics configuration *myself* in order to get this game to boot. I should not have to finish coding the game for you in order to get the game to launch, and yes, this game has had numerous patches supposedly fixing all the problems it came with when it was released (HA!).

This has just solidified my reasoning that Ubisoft really doesn't care about the consumer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014696633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 5464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1535216993}
review:
Never played any of the Trials games before, Seen this on sale for ¬£6 so becasue it was something alittle different than id normally play i thought id give it a try, Kind of reminds me in ways of a mixture of FlatOut & TrackMania but on a trials bike. Great graphics and really fun gameplay, The physics can be really fun too. Some of the late tracks are really insane and really challenging.

Cool thing is there is a track editor and the devs share maps between console & pc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044034882', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1464715017}
review: I recommend this game if it is on sale. There are many tracks to play and the game offers a decent amount of customization from your character to your bike. The initial release without multiplayer was a real pain, as they kept spitting out more and more paid DLC rather than fixing some core issues.

review: TO be honest, i think the whole future thing was not a good move. It was really disapointing not seeing the woods and the dirt as much as trials evolution. author: {'steamid': '76561198109759012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1466896491}
review: I love this game. I have more hours offline than what my account shows. This was my first experience with Trials series (I did play Evo after this game to compare) and between the two, they are fairly equal. This game offers better graphics than Evo and the challenges are fun to complete as well. I went ahead and purchased the season pass as well (for $16 for the game plus all dlc, can't complain). This is not an easy game by any means, and to be honest, this game (as straight forward as it is) SHOULD be a boring game. However, it's not even close! I can spend 30 minutes perfecting a 40 second track, trying to complete the challenges, restarting the level 100 times, blah blah blah, AND still love doing it. It is exciting, fast paced and gives you a good laugh. You will get frustrated from time to time, but I can't think of a game where I haven't been. I have been having some issues connecting to multiplayer, so for that reason I would score this a 9.5/10. If Evo goes on sale ever as well, I will be purchasing that one too. If you are new to the series, then I recommend 100%. If you are a seasoned player, I suggest reading other players reviews and deciding off of their reviews as I have not had enough time yet to get into the heart of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962902326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1426090035}
review:
This series is just so sad. I have Trials HD wich i got when i bought my xbox 360, and it's one of the best games i've played, i have so many hours sunk in to that it's not even funny.

 Then Trials Evolution came out, and i was so happy... until i played it. And Trials Fusion is suffering from the same things that Trials Evolution was. They have gone so far from the Trials HD idea that they are just bad games now.
 It seems like they are more focused on racing instead of the "trials" part. 
It's not even close to have the feeling Trials HD had when getting over obstacles. Getting past obstacles in Trials HD was alot of the times skill based, but in the 2 followup games it seems that you just have to keep on trying until luck kicks in and pray to god that you are ready for it and you dont screw up.

In alot of places there is no reason in how the bike behaves so you can't plan for it, just do it over and over again until you get lcuky and guess correctly how the bike is gonna behave.

It's a sad sad story. Trials HD was soooo good and now the games just suck, they are not even fun to play anymore. I bought this in hope that it would be better than " Trials Evolution" and maybe it is, a little bit, but it's still a bad game and I officially give up hope that the "Trials" ever will be as good as they were in the beginning. And it is a crying shame really

The people at Ubi / Redlynx finally started updating Track Central with manually converted console (XB1, PS4, X360) tracks so you have cool new challenging tracks to play every week. author: {'steamid': '76561198007090390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1551121619}
review:
The game by itself is amazing and the $/hour value is insane with all the content you get from used created content, but there's a slight flaw which is best explained with an example:

1. Decide to play the game.
2. uDontPlay update
3. Launch game - unskippable logos, but that's okay they're short.
4. Preload before the main menu. Okay, could've done that during splash screens, but okay.
5. Connecting to Ubisoft servers.....
6. Still connecting.
7. Failed to connect to Ubisoft servers, hit retry,
8. Finally connected to Ubisoft servers, yay.
9. Browse around the menus checking for new stuff.
10. Random freeze, Ctrl+Alt+Del => End task.
11. Wait for uDontPlay to do some bs before it shuts down.
12. Relaunch game, surprisingly uDontPlay hasn't been updated since then.
13. Splash screen logos, preload, connecting to Ubisoft servers.
14. Failed to connect to Ubisoft servers, hit retry.
15. Go straight for playing this time, let's see the new content.
16. Spend ~2minutes to complete the first medium map in the new pack, loving it!
17. Autosave after the level completion takes about as much time as the level itself.
18. Lost connection to the Ubisoft servers............. That explains it.
19. Hit retry, twice this time, before it actually works.
20. Back, back, back, back, quit game.

That's ~15-20 minutes of Ubisoft bullcrap to play two minutes of an otherwise solid game.
Guess I'll try again in a couple months.... but every time I try to pick this game back up it's the same reason that makes me shelve it and that's uDontPlay.
I'll admit, the freeze could've been a bug from Redlynx's side, but I wouldn't be surprised if Ubisoft DRM is so well integrated that it is the reason why the menus are so slow to swap inbetween to begin with.
Setting up Excitebike on a NES emulator from scratch would probably take less time than each fresh launch of Trials through uPlay after a prolongued absence.

TL;DR Great game that's close to unplayable thanks to a U shaped anchor.

review: Every now ad then I still play this title even though I find it incredibly frustrating to play. The only reason why I do is because I purchased the Season Pass, so I feel obligated to play when the new content releases. I feel that Trials Evolution was the pinnacle to this franchise. The tracks aren't nearly as fun to play in Fusion. The FMX tracks are a joke and would have been an addition that should have been subtracted. To say that I enjoy playing them would be the same as anyone saying they love a mouth full of cavities. I suggest that if you want to play a great Trials game then please pick up Evolution. Or grab any tablet and play Frontier (that one is actually a ton of fun).

author: {'steamid': '76561198030920805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1459727676}
review: There are three major issues that break this game for me. First, if you don't play for a while and want to start fresh, you can't. It's impossible to delete your Track Central data and start from a completely blank slate. Second, your times and ghosts aren't locally saved, so in order to beat your own times on the tracks, you have to have a cloud save, which cannot be completely erased. Third, you have install Uplay, a piece of software which basically duplicates Steam, in order to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988895320', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1513528739}
review:
i bought the game after seeing the "multiplayer" stamp on it. when it was finally released i was sooooo disappointed. it only had local multiplayer. usually games which only have local has the stamp "local" or "local coop" on it. this doesnt, and they explain it with "online mode will come later". it has now been 9 months and we finally get multiplayer. amazing right?
no, not at all. the online mode doesnt allow all tracks to be played like the last game did. it only accepts one type of track, and that is supercross x. which means all those amazing tracks you'd play as a ghost against your friends cant be played.

im so mad that i paid full price for a game that dissapointed me twice, first for lieing and then for promising "online mode like never seen before" with an extremely toned down version of online multiplayer.

0/10, go play trials evo instead. its 100000000000000 times better

author: {'steamid': '76561198005154483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1406199204}
review:
This is NOT a bad game.  Its not the best optimization I've ever seen, there's no getting around that but the gameplay itself is solid.

The problem stems not from the game itself but from the platform its on.  This is literally one of the very, very few games I would warn against obtaining on your rig; if you have a PS4 or Xbone, get it on there because from what I'm told the community on those platforms is still thriving.

Trials -needs- a thriving community of track builders to keep it good since the default tracks on this are boring and quite honestly, the blandest they've ever been.  I can respect them trying to give it a "back story" in the style of Portal but really, it wasn't needed.

But the really killer is that the community is gone.  What is Trials without its community?

author: {'steamid': '76561198010839829', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3573, 'last_played': 1539967055}
review:
This game is my go to time killer, it's not for everyone though.
You should NOT buy this game IF you don't like spending  hours trying to perfect a level, or use 30 minutes on a level and then have the  game tell you that you took too long.

Although this game is so rewarding when you pull off that insanely difficult  jump, or when you beat everyones high score. This is a time waster, if you make it through to the extreme maps, then I'd say good luck. 

The difficulty of the game ranges from beginner, easy, normal, hard, extreme. When you are on the beginner maps you'll blast through the  levels, although when you move up, it'll of  course get harder - a lot harder. 

The game has 1  big bug which could put you off buying it though. It's that low fps cause a slowmotion effect, which renders the game more or less unplayable. A solution is to lower the settings, but i'd just like to include this.  

The DLC that's out so far (3 out of 6 planned)  they're all worth picking up IF you like the game. I'd say they're more difficult than the other maps, but not by much. In each DLC  you get atleast 9 new trails. I think you'd have to be a person that wants to get the best medal on everything to justify the 5‚Ç¨ price tag though.

I personally love this game when I need to take a break from everything. It's calming and frustrating in a weird sort of way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116681282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1464798720}
review:
I first saw this game when TheBlazeJP did a 100% speedrun during #SGDQ2014,and that speedrun/his speedruns of other Trials games was what got me into playing Trials in the first place,with Fusion being my very first Trials game I've played myself.

This game is one of those games where it's addicting and frusterating as hell at the same time(I can guarantee that after 10 hours of playing at the time of this review,trying to get most of the gold medals),but it's really fun regardless.

The controls aren't actually that hard to get used to because they're a Happy Wheels style,I guess the only wonky thing being the FMX,but for me the FMX wasn't a huge deal.

The skill games are really interesting,each skill game(and each track)having it's own quirks,and those along with the Rider's shouts during every track are some of the funniest/most entertaining parts of the game

If you're looking for a game that's fun but still really challenging,seriously get this or Evolution,you won't regret it

10/10 from me :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031359995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1428108030}
review:
I'm going to warn you right now that RedLynx was absorbed by Ubisoft and now comes with all the Uplay content you never asked for.

So let's just pretend that part doesn't exist, and what we're left with is a satisfying improvement over the previous Trials game. The graphics may not be the most impressive, but an improved render distance, additional particles on screen, and the ability to add many more objects on screen has let both the devs and the community build some of the most impressive tracks yet. The controls are still tight and precise, and without any bike upgrade system, you can only rely on improving your skills if you want to ace all the tracks. The newly added trick system can be a bit buggy at times, but somewhat realistically affects your bike balance in ways you may not be expecting.

+Trick System
+The Trials you know and love
+Rewards improving skill but can be frusteratingly difficult at times
+Endless Editor content
-Uplay
-Annoying AI commentary

author: {'steamid': '76561197964668417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1164, 'last_played': 1692566257}
review:
One of the biggest disappointements in my collection. I wish I could blame uplay, but none of my gripes with this game have anything to do with ubisoft's sad attempt at making a steam clone. If I wrote this review the day I got it and didn't purchase the season pass along with it I might have recommended it because back then it was good for the price. Instead you pay 20$+20$ for a game that seems to run more and more crappily everytime they update it, the dlc isn't exactly mind blowing for the price and it's been almost a year without the promised multiplayer. Originally, back when I first purchased it I could run it on ultra (my system is better than their recommended), but now I have massive stuttering and frame loss especially on the newer dlc levels. At this point I've only gotten 3 of the 6 promised DLCs and I am ready to uninstall it and pretend I never got it in the first place. Might even harass steam to give me back my money for this garbage.

TLDR; You want to play trials? Go get Trials Evolution. In fact; go get a used 360 (if you don't own one) and get it on that instead because it doesn't have uplay stuffed up it's ass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027481699', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1432995035}
review:
--NOTE - review is over 5 years old and is not reflective of the game in its current state--

Please take time to read the whole review...

Don't get me wrong, by itself Trials Fusion is a decent game - Great graphics, great scenery and keeps the elements of its predecessors without changing too much. However, as a person who has dedicated over 120 hours into Trials Evolution Gold Edition, I must say that Fusion is pretty underwhelming compared to it.

First of all, there are significantly fewer levels in this game than there are in TEGE - it took me at least 20 hours to get the medal tally required to unlock the platinum medals, but in Fusion it only took me 4 hours. It definitely felt like a step backwards in content.

This leads to the next point - Ubisoft decided that in order for us to get more levels, we'd have to fork out money for a season pass. That's right, they took our beloved Trials franchise and decided to include DLC in it. It definitely feels like a dog move against us.

Lastly, they decided to leave out the most essential feature when they released this game - online multiplayer! And only this year they decide they're finally going to release it? Pretty crap if you ask me.

Final verdict - If you have played Trials Evolution Gold Edition for a while and feel like playing some new, different levels, buy this game when it's on sale, as if you ignore all of its flaws it's a pretty good game.
If you have never played a trials game before, buy Trials Evolution Gold Edition as it is a lot more fun to play than this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058266821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1578628344}
review:
Un juego muy entretenido, si te gustan los juegos extremos de motocross, este te va a encantar!
En mi opini√≥n, es un juego muy divertido que por un lado tiene sus puntos positivos y algunos negativos. 

Empezando por lo positivo:

El juego en su modo 'Trayectoria' tiene gran variedad de niveles atractivos donde te podr√°s hechar unas cuantas horas para entretenerte, pero lo que m√°s hace conservar su entretenimiento (que probablemente sea lo m√°s atractivo del juego) es la secci√≥n 'Central de Pistas' donde se pueden jugar gran cantidad de niveles hechos por otros usuarios y muchos de ellos son muy atractivos, adem√°s que todos los d√≠as siempre vamos a encontrar pistas nuevas subidas por la comunidad para jugar en dicha secci√≥n. Adem√°s incluye un editor de niveles, para crear tu propio nivel y subirlo a la comunidad y que lo puedan jugar otros usuarios dentro de esta secci√≥n.

Tambi√©n se incluyen otras secciones como 'Torneos' donde consta de una serie de desaf√≠os (con niveles del modo Trayectoria tomados al azar) que van cambiando diariamente (o cada 2 d√≠as) con el fin de competir con otros jugadores en la tabla de puntajes y seg√∫n el puesto final pod√©s conseguir puntos y otras bonificaciones, como ganar equipamiento, partes de motos, dinero del juego, etc.

Entre otros contenidos, el juego incluye 6 motos, equipamiento y trajes para el personaje, que a medida que vayamos ganando experiencia y avanzando niveles vamos desbloqueando m√°s de estos contenidos.

Por √∫ltimo, tambi√©n incluye modo multijugador, pero desgraciadamente por el momento se incluye modo multijugador local para jugarlo con otros amigos en una misma pc o consola, pero la buena noticia que pr√≥ximamente llegar√° el parche con el modo multijugador online tal como lo anunci√≥ Ubisoft donde se podr√° competir en partidas online de hasta 8 jugadores, y eso har√° mucho m√°s divertido el juego, ya que hasta el momento tenemos que andar compitiendo con otros jugadores batiendo mejores records que realizaron otros en alg√∫n momento que jugaron y eso en mi opini√≥n aburre muy r√°pido.


Ahora vamos con los puntos negativos:

La primer contra, como muchos habr√°n criticado, est√° en que el programa requiere el Uplay para jugarlo (por lo que tenemos que crearnos una cuenta de Uplay (si no tenemos) para iniciar sesi√≥n) que para muchos puede ser molesto en el sentido de que la ejecuci√≥n del juego no solo depende de tener el Steam sino tambi√©n de tener el Uplay con la sesi√≥n iniciada.

Otro punto negativo est√° en la mala optimizaci√≥n del juego (cosa que ha sido mejorado en los √∫ltimos parches), donde se hace complicado alcanzar los 60 fps en calidades altas con una buena PC y para ello debemos bajar los detalles gr√°ficos para correrlo m√°s fluido.

Y por √∫ltimo, est√° en que algunos contenidos del juego requieren un pase de temporada llamado Season Pass para tener acceso a dichos contenidos (como los DLC del juego y sus futuros DLC que van a salir), que esto molesta m√°s en la secci√≥n 'Central de Pistas' donde muchos de los niveles creados por otros usuarios requieren dicho pase para jugarlo, a menos que tengas adquirido los DLC del juego, ya que esto se debe a que estos niveles que requieren dicho pase fueron creados con alg√∫n DLC del juego, y para tener acceso a los DLC te sugiere obtener este pase, o como alternativa, si no queres el pase, comprar cada DLC del juego por separado.

Pero en conclusi√≥n, es un gran juego y lo recomiendo mucho ya que te atrapa con varias horas para entretenerte.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981915737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1437174598}
review:
Just finished the 'story' after about 5 hours, but there I a ton left to do earning medals and perfecting the super challenging expert levels that unlocked. Fun & addicting, unfortunately that's offset right now by a few things like Uplay and online multiplayer that doesn't seem to work. 

I also had some major frame-rate issues in some of the maps. I don't have the most beefy PC but I was able to run 95% of the game on high settings except for a few levels. I tried dropping to "low" to see if things would improve on just those levels but no luck. Seems to just be a part of the game and with something that requires precision, it was frustrating when a jerky framerate would mess me up.

Realisticaly the uplay integration isn't too annoying once you set it up, but why can't I get Steam achievements instead of uplay achievements (or at least both)? 


If you really dig this type of game I'd pick it up. But for the reasons above I couldn't recommend it at full-price right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075991490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2334, 'last_played': 1599032225}
review:
I recommend Trials Fusion the game, but Trials Fusion for PC is a scam. The game doesn't run properly, it doesn't matter how good your PC is, it's port to the PC is the wost I've ever seen. It's practically unplayable. Trials is all about reaction and skill, imagine how hard it is when the game is constantly dropping to 15-20 fps and going slow motion below 60. The famerate is all over the place at all times for every track. So basically, have fun trying to control your rider as the game is frequently changing speed and frame rate. Even with their updates, lowering your graphics, lowering your resolution, turning off v-sync, turning on frame skipping, setting Trails Fusion to high priority and PC settings to performance, you will only marginally improve it. This game should be removed from Steam for quality control, they sold you a completely broken game that they don't even try to fix, or make good on. Absolutely shameful display of flippant disregard for the PC customers who shelled out the money and can't even make use of it as a paperweight. 

DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. GAME. FOR. PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112269426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1419971880}
review:
Un juego muy entretenido al que le puedes echar muchas horas. Los controles no son para nada dif√≠ciles y hay una buena variedad de niveles. No obstante, el verdadero atractivo de este juego son los niveles creados por los usuarios. Cada d√≠a te encuentras niveles nuevos, y algunos de ellos muy currados. Creo que hay unas 5 o 6 motos, y otros tantos trajes para el personaje, lo cual no est√° mal. Tienen prometido un modo multijugador, veremos a ver cu√°ndo sale.

Por desgracia hay unos cuantos puntos negativos. En primer lugar est√° la mala optimizaci√≥n. Yo deber√≠a poderlo jugar en calidad alta y sin embargo tengo que jugarlo en media-baja para poder llegar a 60 fps. En segundo lugar, usa Uplay, que ya sabemos todos el asco que da... Y en tercer lugar, que algunos niveles de los usuarios requieren season pass. Afortunadamente estos niveles suelen recibir votos negativos y aparecen al final de la lista. Estos de Ubisoft se creen que pueden timar a los usuarios de PC xDD.

En conclusi√≥n, es un juego muy muy entretenido y personalmente lo recomiendo, pero hay que tener en cuenta los puntos negativos que he mencionado arriba porque le pueden fastidiar la experiencia a m√°s de uno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095098568', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1509630642}
review:
Contrairement √† d'autres personnes je trouve la fusion entre UPlay et Steam (sans jeu de mots) tr√®s int√©ressante car on peux avoir un acc√®s √† des: motos/skin/wallpaper/soundtrack, en faisant quelques d√©fis UPlay ce qui donne une plus longue dur√©e de vie au jeu (sachant qu'il y a un √©diteur de map et des DLC, sa vie est encore plus allonger). Compar√© √† Trials Evolution, des nouveaux v√©hicules sont disponible (TKO Panda, Quad et Rabbit, V√©lo). Je trouve les map mieux class√© car √† certains moment je restais bloqu√© sur un level.
On peut maintenant faire des figure :D (exemple: Superman, backflip, sur-le-cot√© flip...), il sont aussi cumulable pour avoir PLUS de points (exemple: Front superman flip).

  Graphiquement, le jeu reste tr√®s beau √† voir m√™me si il ressemble un peu √† Evolution.

  Gameplay, Du trials, de la rage, des jeux d'adresses en tout genre, vous connaissez la suite...

  Prix du jeu, je le trouve assez cher si vous voulez le prendre avec le season pass, il vaut mieux attendre une offre.

  Beaucoup de personnes se plaigne que un multijoueur n'est pas disponible mais c'est en Beta sa arrivera bient√¥t (d'ailleurs vous pouvez cherch√© sur internet une cl√© Beta pour le multi).

  Ma note, 8/10, la s√©rie trials s'am√©liore, beaucoup plus de possibilit√©s, je me sens oblig√© de mettre plus que 5, mais pas plus que 8 car le jeu n'est pas parfait.
  *Edit*: Multijoueur sorti sur le jeu final le 27 janvier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038180102', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1699090265}
review:
Reccomended because it wont stay if not reccomended


I have played the origonal Trials HD on the 360 and at that time it was AWESOME then they cam out with Evolution still cool, after they fixed some problems it had :/ THEN IT CAME OUT FOR PC :D and i was at first excited but soon found out it was (at release) Poorly optimized but i digress, it was fixed and i could enjoy it ..... then this game cam along ;/ least i can say is that i was excited at first but after they fixed the poor FPS thing i realized that this was JUTS LIKE A MODDED VERSION OF Evolution no seriously play evolution then play this game ... it is the same engine but with nome skin packs and a few new objects on a different map NOT really a COMPLETELY NEW game ... i should add that multiplayer (at realese) was promised to be worked on and i waited a while and NOTHIN just nuthin except local. Dispicable i was hopeing for better from a MULTI MILLION DOLLAR CORPERATION ... But i guess i can come to expect less from Ubisoft  


I DO NOT RECCOMEND THIS GAME unless you are fine with only local multiplayer with online only drm (Uplay) so no real offline capibilitys  and dont mind that this game is not much more than a skin mod and a new map for Evolution

author: {'steamid': '76561198009351848', 'num_games_owned': 1396, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1770, 'last_played': 1528600655}
review:
It's a good game, but it's not as good as Trials Evolution. That game was very long and offered so much deversity in the modes and level design. Add the crazy amount of unique user created levels, multiplayer and you have a classic.


Cons - Fusion is a pretty short game and the heavy handed futuristic theme is off putting after a while. If I have to hear that, welcome to future song one more time, ugh! The DLC has been pretty nice but they're short levels and not worth the price. The selection of user created levels is limited and not very interesting so far. No online multiplayer and the local multiplayer is a shallow experience. The later levels get ridiculously hard.

Pros - It's still a Trials game and the controls are awesome. The new trick feature done with the analog sticks is a welcomed addition. The soundtrack during the levels are pretty sweet. So I still have to recommend it if you're a Trials fan, but I'd wait till i goes down in price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970504680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1424488490}
review:
Trials Fusion is a work of beauty.

I may not be an aficionado, having only spent ~100 hours playing the original.  Mostly by myself, but often with friends, loving every second of it.  I've probably crashed 100,000 times, but I have a few accomplishments in the more extreme trials that I'm proud of.

If that describes your love of the game, then you will like this one too.  I've read that some people have problems with framerates, but I have not.  The video options allow for a lot of tweaking to match your video card's capabilities it seems.  I have 18 hours clocked on Trials Fusion at the time of writing this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103152004', 'num_games_owned': 682, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1567267667}
review:
I'd say legitimately 98% of the tracks in this game are locked behind DLC, the custom tracks are overrated tbh, you can barely find any to play unless you buy the season pass. The tracks included with the game are decent but you could get most of them done in 5 hours or so and then you're just stuck with the odd few maps you can find that don't need DLC.

Also the game is full of fps drops and if you're not great at Trials, the harder stages are way too difficult, this would be fine if I could go and find some more in my skill level in the custom maps, but as I say, most of them are locked behind a season pass paywall.

review:
The music is great, the graphics look good, the gameplay is... it's, it's not very great. The levels are dumbed down from Trials Evolution. The challenge is getting past certain parts of the map that your bike can or cannot reach at random times. You could do the same think 10 times and the results would be different. The physics for the bike vs the person don't really make any sense either. Sometimes the bike is super heavy and other times it is as light as paper while the driver is the one with all the inertia. Oh, and no online multiplayer

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197981896021', 'num_games_owned': 1240, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1413751671}
review:
Well I didn't expect much out of this game... but I got it simply because I can always wind down with long easy Trials levels.
Reading the reviews of this game, I knew it wasn't much, so I don't regret buying the game. However, I cannot recommend buying this if you are looking for a good Trials game.

It is buggy, some levels are unbearably laggy (bad optimization) and the "skill games" from the previous Trials game are baaaack! And even more annoying than ever! If you want to play with keyboard, don't bother trying to do anything with those games. Ubisoft themselves wrote that they were designed for pad. But, these games are so lame that I can't be bothered configuring my pad.

The levels (when they aren't laggy) are bland. There is no challenge. I play this game when I want to wind down... It's good for that. But if you are looking for a Trials challenge, you won't find it here.
Also, you need to pay much more to get the other half of this game (DLC) and there is no multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968300492', 'num_games_owned': 783, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1413647567}
review:
I haven't played Trials since way back when Trials HD was released on the Xbox 360.  The game has gotten a lot flashier since then.  For most of the game I found myself wondering where the challenge went ... and then I got to extreme mode.  The leap in difficulty from expert to extreme is, well, extreme!  It was too much for me but I still enjoyed every failure!

Playtime: 8h
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045132769', 'num_games_owned': 1867, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1412993992}
review:
This game's alright... I'm not at all alright while playing it, but I still love it. After the rage wears off, the game gives you a good sense of accomplishment when you finally get that 0 fault gold medal run, especially on later (hard) stages.

While Trials Fusion is a streamlined trials game (it is much, much easier than Evolution), there is still a good amount of hard tracks in the base game, and a few of them only the most persistent players will be able to "gold medal" (while others will rage quit out of the game and write a review...). There are 8 zones in the base game, and each one has 6 to 10 tracks in it (8 on average), that number is significantly increased with the season pass, which adds 6 new zones. Right now, 9/10/2014, the season pass only offers 3 zones, with 3 more on the way before May 2015. The game also includes a track editor, so you can create your own tracks, and you can easily access and play tracks built by other people online (which are pretty impressive from what I've seen/played).

Now I'm not a big fan of Ubisoft's PC releases, because I usually get hit by poor optimization issues that plague a lot of their games at release, this game's performance however, pleasantly surprised me and put a big fat smile on my face, after the stutter fest that was Trials Evolution Gold Edition, I wasn't very hopeful going into this one. The game runs perfectly smooth maxed out on my machine, and the only stutter I got was on a graphically intensive track, while I had 2 video streams running in the background, after trying the same track without flash videos hogging my cpu, the stutter went away, and the game ran buttery smooth again.

For reference, my PC specs are:

i7 920 @3Ghz
gtx660ti 2gb
8gb ram
win7 64bit

It's worth mentioning that the game has a pretty good, yet weird sense of humor, for example whenever you finish a track, something funny and dumb is sure to happen, like the rider falling of his bike after he crosses the finish line, landing in the water and racing a cruise ship, or when you cross a finish line that's on top of a 2 story hut, the door closes behind you, and the hut starts flying off like a rocket. I also really enjoy the AI commentary (I guess you can call them the narrators), and the biker's yells and woohoos remind me of Homer Simpson.

This game is a steal even at full price, and on a decent sale it should be a no-brainer if you played and liked previous Trials games, but I'm sure 2D platformer game enthusiasts would love it as well. As for the score, I'm giving it a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129232073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1555, 'last_played': 1708815300}
review:
If you would like the game to be even halfway close to riding a real motorcycle you will be dissapointed. It does not take that much time to figure out that the people that wrote the program have never actually riden a motorcycle before in their life. Let alone ever been on a trials track. There is no just lean a little foward. But there is a lurch forward hard enough that you land on your face every time. There is no just tapping the brakes. But there is a total lock up of the front wheel wheel that is going to throw you on your face every time though. The rider has 3 postions, jerking back, learching forward, and riding in the middle with nothing else. I am dissapointed with how real this game is.
    But if you want a game that is just a motorcycle game, this is for you. The tracks are a challange to say the least, but the visuals are great. The game looks fantastic. Just not very real.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966724490', 'num_games_owned': 2672, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1412884505}
review:
Even though the original Trials games fell flat for me, feeling repetitive and lacking in anything resembling an interesting challenge in most of the levels, I nevertheless picked up Fusion after watching some videos of it.

After spending two hours on it(which is a about 30-40% through the career mode), I can safely say this is an improvement in every area. The levels are so much more varied and much more entertaining, and Redlynx has really realised that going for low-light environments is a terrible idea. The new levels are bright, futuristic, and so much fun to traverse.

Even the soundtrack got a massive beauty treatment; Petri Alanko, famous for his work on Alan Wake, provided an absolutely astonishing lineup of music that sets the mood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008935954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1434192484}
review: I bought the game a couple of days ago, installed it and pressed "Play". The games crashes on startup giving a "Trials_fusion.exe has stopped working" message. Very dissapointing. I've found other people having the same problem online but no solution yet. I messed with the config file a little bit, changing the resolution to my screen's resolution and then instead of getting the previous message I get one saying that Direct X 10.1 or more is needed which is weird because I have Direct X 11. Is there anyway to return the game and get a refund?

author: {'steamid': '76561198004555410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1450401457}
review:
Like Tetrix, some game excels because of its simplicity. It is so true for the Trials series. The goal of the game is simple, to get your bike from point A to point B as fast as possible without crashing, and all the controls you have is accelerate, break, leaning forward and back. However, the game gets challenging very fast and you always want to try again just to chip a few millisecond or to manage that difficult jump.

Compares to its predecessors, Fusion offer a cleaner, more futuristic setting. Some players will miss the more gritty setting of Trials Evolution. The game offers nicer lighting, some neat bloom effects, and nice post-processing effects. Overall the graphic is very beautiful and crashes are spectacular.

The game add a few new twists like being able to pull tricks with your right thumbstick. I find it a shame they add this feature and yet removed the ability to share replays on Youtube. What is the point of pulling spectacular stunts yet unable to show off to others? 

Likewise, there is no longer online multiplayer, which is promised again and again by the developer but no ETA is in sight. Given there are already 2 DLCs released you can tell the developer is focusing their efforts on making money instead of finishing the multiplayer feature of the game. There is local multiplayer you can play with your buddy on the same sceen.

You can also make your own tracks, and at the writing of this review there are already over two thousands user generated tracks online, and many of them are top quality and add to the longitivity of the game. Which is necessary because there are much fewer tracks than Trial Evolution Gold. Again, I feel the developers are holding off the initial release of tracks to sell them as future DLCs, which BTW at 4.99$ for 10 tracks is quite pricy.

Gameplay wise the official tracks are well designed but most of them are shorter than TEG. I find there are some twicks to the physics and overall a bit more forgiving than TEG. You can also make 1 or 2 faults and still get Gold on some tracks which I like because it is less frustrating, but I can see hard-core player won't like the change.

Overall, I'd still recommand the game just because the overall concept is awesome. However, I don't like the business practice of the developer and would recommand you to get the game when on sale, where you can get the main game and the season pass as one package within reasonable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977711487', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1623586088}
review: Still no online multiplayer, constant 10 track DLC which revives the game for a few hours at a time. However not a patch on Trials HD for the Xbox 360 or Evolution (which included Trials HD but not any of the 40+ DLC). review: Le concept est pas neufs, le gameplay non plus mais c'est tellement addictif de vouloir ou faire un beau run bien fluide ou trouver le passage bien crade qui fait gagner une demie seconde. Et puis comme je l'ai deja dis meme si le gameplay n'est pas neuf il est parfait, au bout de quelques piste on arrive a faire exactement ce que l'on veux (manette recommand√©). Des petit tuto on √©t√© ajout√© en d√©but de chapitre, pas mal pour les novices de la franchise, dommage qu'il soit obligatoire car un peu longuet. j'apprecie aussi l'effort qui a √©t√© apporter au level design qui est bien recherch√© et plutot vari√© c'est beau surtout si vous pouvez poussez tout les graphisme a fond (attention il faut une bonne config materiel) et il est parfois plaisant de "rouler cool" pour profiter des paysage et accomplir les defis plutt sympa souvent dur. bref je recommende chauddement a tout amateru de pres ou de loin !

author: {'steamid': '76561198025530565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1652212651}
review:
I've always like the Trials franchise and this one isn't any different. Its pretty easy and entertaining up untill you get to the hard levels.... Then it's very frustrating but theres nothing like learning how to beat a level that has beat you so many times in the past.

The graphics are beautiful but it seems like the game isn't very well optimised or my graphics card is showing its age. I had to turn the setting to medium so it wouldn't fall under 30fps (most of the time. It still does sometimes). Another thing I noticed is that the framerate seems to effect the gameplay. When my frames would drop the game would get slower.... dunno if that means its hardcoded to the framerate or what but it was quite annoying till i lowered the settings.

The online tracks range from awesome and fun to terrible and frustrating. Some tracks are smooth where you can hit most of the jumps perfect and just makes for an enjoyable experience. On the other hand some tracks are horribly designed (understandably, these people aren't pro designers) with bad camera angles and obsticles that you basically have to have blind luck not to crash into. Another thing about online tracks is that a lot of them aren't rated correctly. You'll have tracks that are medium that should be labeled easy and some that are hard/extreme that are labeled medium.

Overall it's an enjoyable game if you like these type of games. At the moment it's on the humble bundle store for $9.99 which I'd say is worth it.

One other thing I forgot, it's a Ubisoft game so it requires Uplay.
Uplay is annoying

Edit: One last thing I forgot to mention is that there's this bug that has been in most of the trials games where you're going up a hill and you let off the gas and lean forward and your back wheel comes off of the ground, you lose traction and fall to your doom.... I fucking hate that... Theres no physical way to actually lift your back wheel off of the ground when you're in that position....... I have no clue why they think it works like that but it is very frustrating and will (judging by it being in the last trials game too) never be fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002730938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1410118089}
review:
I'm a bit sad that I can't really reccommend this. I wanted more Trials, just to get rid of the shakes, but this.. 
This is most likely not the "More Trials!" you are looking for. 
Play Trials Evloution instead, if you have not done so and/or wait for the next one, where they hopefully tune some of the stuff back to "functionaltiy over visuals".

Pros:
- Graphics are amazing. Really, really pretty.
- Still the same great Trials physics, bike handling feels almost exactly like the previous ones

Cons:
- UPLAY
-- This piece of garbage. BigPicture & COntroller -> Start any UPlay game -> Wait for Uplay updates & start looking for the mouse to click "Start". The day UPlay dies will be a happy one. Make a suicide pact with Origin please, why don't you.
 
- Visuals over functionality
-- Camera too often shows the scenery instead of the track you are about to land on
-- Performance was never great with the Trials games, but because of the grat graphics and their camera work, Fusion performs HORRIBLE at times - which really sucks in a skill based "pixel perfect" thing, when you fail because of lag/hitches

- "Trick Mode" is just bad. Right stick to perform stunts w/ the bike while in the air. Sounds nice, controlls horrbily. HORRIBLY.
-- These levels are mandatory and mixed in with the normal Trials stuff and that sucks, because it just does not work well


I like trials more than I'd normaly publicly admit to, but this.. Yes, Trials should feel frustrating. 
But not because some Designer went "Hey stop showing so much of the track, show the background, we spent a lot of money making this!". 

They essentially broke their game with that attitude, about 50% of all levels I have played have had this. I am at about halway through, and between that and the Trick stuff, this is it for me, and I am actually a bit sad about this.. I want more real Trials.. :/

Also, that intro Song.. O.o

Next time, just make Trials Evloution 2, yes? Everyone will love you again and actually play your game..Thanks! :)
