author: {'steamid': '76561198015078127', 'num_games_owned': 1754, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1422119483}
review:
[b][u]A CONTROLLER IS RECOMMENDED, BUT NOT REQUIRED![/u][/b]

[u]If you've played these games before, skip this section:[/u]

The Trials series is a physics based "platformer" racing title where you can race against friends and have the results be a fraction of a second off. The game can get pretty difficult and the map makers can turn the game into something entirely different. The games require uPlay as a second DRM, but if you just want one DRM, you can buy it from uPlay directly (and might save money doing so, as Ubisoft wants their uPlay service to grow bigger.) You'd like this game if you are into racing and competiting, though you might still love it if you hate typical racing games.

[u]For a comparison to Trials Evolution, the last Trials game:[/u]

[b]Pros:[/b]
- Track editor is miles ahead of the older editor, meaning cooler content if you don't like to edit your own tracks.
- You can do cool stuns in midair, used in a nice points-based "race."
- Can customize your biker and your vehicle, including the new ATV.
- Challenges to complete on every map with very unique challenges on certain maps.
- Hidden secrets on some maps.
- SQUIRRELS!

[b]Cons:[/b]
- What is optimization? Where did you take my frames? Why did you steal them?
- The opening theme will get annoyingly stuck in your head if you don't move past it fast... 
WE'LL GO TO THE FUTURE! MAN! MACHINE! THE FUSION! ...WELCOME TO THE FUTURE! *Repeat 100 times*
- Currently only local multiplayer, but there are ghosts of friends to race against (Online MP will be patched in later.)
- [i]Unyielding (beat track without tilting; use only gas and brake and never crashing) and Full Throttle (Never let go of gas and never fault) challenges can go fuck themselves...[/i] 
[b]Might be a pro if you're a masochist.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198051496034', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1400782380}
review:
Ganz ehrlich? Ich hatte mich richtig auf das Spiel gefreut, Trials HD war klasse, und Evo noch ein zacken besser.
Ok ich hatte schon Angst, √ºberall wo der Mainstream ankommt, wird alles kaputt gemacht. Nun hat es Trials auch erwischt, es wird massentauglich gemacht, was man Ubisoft als Konzern nicht √ºbel nehmen kann, die wollen uns halt melken.

Ende vom Lied? 90% der Strecken sind so leicht, mit halbwegs Skill rast man einfach so durch. Gold, Gold, Gold, es rasselt nur so Medalien. Klar, soll ja jeder schaffen.... Sonst kauft er oder sie den n√§chsten Trials Teil halt nicht.

Am Ende bekommt man ein Fahrrad, kein Witz. Dieses macht den Motor√§dern nicht nur Konkurrenz, nein, es √ºbertrifft sie.. So ein Schwachsinn.. Dann haben wir noch ein Quad, sinnlos, brauch keiner. Zu den Tricks sag ich mal nichts, ist geschmackssache. 

Ich empfehle dieses Spiel nicht, denn Trials Evo ist eindeutig viel besser....

author: {'steamid': '76561197970224075', 'num_games_owned': 1416, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1428865812}
review:
[Edit] After nearly a year I can now recommend this game as Ubisoft have fully delivered everything they originally announced.

[IGNORE BELOW - ORIGINAL REVIEW]

I feel cheated..

I've been a fan of the Trials series for some years now having played many of them I decided to purchase Trials Fusion. Now while the game runs smoothly, without any "slow motion" or fps drops that others have mentioned my main issue comes with the advertising of this game on Steam.

Upon purchasing the game, Steam reads:
Single Player
Multiplayer

However, this is not the case. Trials Fusion only supports Local Multiplayer and from what I can find out on the web, they are only planning to add Multiplayer in the coming months which to me is false advertising. Whether this is on Steams part or Ubisoft I don't know but it should be made completely clear.

I've now wasted my money on a game I don't intend on playing at all as I bought it solely to play with friends. I'll be seeking a refund for the title as this is just plain wrong.

Also for anyone else reading, the game requires you to launch through uPlay, the more time consuming and irritating game launcher there currently is. Two huge reasons not to buy the game.

review: Good game but bike customisation prone to freezing. Its a bit like a beta currently but I'm sure that will be sorted out in time. It doesn't seem to be the stages that are affected just additional stuff like customisation so the game is still good fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049440292', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1609676238}
review:
In my short time playing it so far, I had a really enjoyable experience.

The visuals in the game are great, especially on high graphic settings. The game plays well with a keyboard, it feels fluid and nice. The tracks included with the game have awesome futuristic designs, and I'm sure there will be many amazing user created tracks soon. I've yet to try the editor but if it's anything like the one in Trials Evolution or even better, I can't wait to try it out.

The game also has some cool music, the main menu soundtrack is sweet!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079789240', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1405406520}
review:
Trials Fusion just beat Trials HD in my book if you hated Evovlution and loved Trials HD on Xbox 360 get this game it's really fun.

The only issue that I see with it right now is that multiplayer isn't going to be up for another month or so.

Everyone elses review mentions UPlay I see nothing wrong with using UPlay besides it just added another application to your computer. 

I recommend everyone to get this game if you have the $20 to spend you will get your moneys worth if you enjoy these types of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982703318', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1398642887}
review:
It's really just more of the same. I preferred the last one, as this futuristic style just feels weird. I like driving over objects that actually exists and that you'd actually drive over in real life.

If you're a perfectionist and refuse to have errors and need to restart every time you wipe out, you'll get annoyed with the pre-scripted voice lines playing over and over and over again. They didn't need to add vocal parts for a game that is based on repitition. Oh well, decent buy I guess, but wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024846484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1643073729}
review:
Being a trails fan ever since the relase of HD, I was incredibly excited to get this.

But of course, whenever i try to play the actual game, I only get around 15 fps at most. Looking at the system requirements, everything seemed a-okay except for my graphics card, which at the time wasnt a huge issue for me as id play on the lowest settings. With games that I dont have the expected graphics card for, all I did was that, and they ran fine.

Except for this game.

Even with the absolute lowest settings I lag like hell. The lag is so unbearable that it goes in slow motion, making it absolutly impossible to play at all. Ive never had any problems with this in the past.

Im going to possibly try to get another graphics card to fix the issue. But until then, I can't reccomend this to anyone.

ALSO, Uplay is the most useless shit ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079737324', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1420983461}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047157292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1513847957}
review:
When the game would suffer any drop in FPS it decides to run in Slow motion. Making it unplayable. Bugs are riddled throughout, Crashing frequently. Being forced to use uPlay you will also be plagued with another service that does not function. and thus removes a loarge proportion of the game as uPlay is unreliable. You must also then wait at every option for the game to attempt to connect to Ubisoft, wasting you time as you are told what you already know, that ubisoft is unavailable.

On top of the game being unplayable for a lot of people, The Deluxe edition with the ason pass has not been transfering across with Uplay, meaning that the Season pass unlocks are still Locked.

Do not buy untill the game is fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961494531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1400725444}
review:
Trials Fusion is just a mindless blast of fun and mayhem. Get some friends together and it only multiplies it, but it's solid even by itself.

Here's a video showcasing my shenanigans in this game for those who are curious. If not, just read the rest of the review below.

http://youtu.be/3CtaMJHEkaY

I'll start by saying the gameplay is pretty simple, but challenging at the same time. The only thing you're doing is balancing your rider and your bike along a path while pounding the gas. However, the balancing part is the main problem and where all the challenge lies. The courses have you flying and leaping over all sorts of nonsensical obstacles, and landing it perfectly just doesn't happen sometimes. Even more so when you're trying to show off in front of your friends and botch the trick. But in my personal opinion, it's more fun failing than it actually is succeeding. It's hilarious watching my rider flop around because I was being a dope and got overzealous in my flips, which is a huge boon to the game because you're having a blast whether you're succeeding or failing miserably like I do sometimes.

The game also doesn't feel cheap, nor feel like it cheats you out of anything. It's easy enough to get a silver medal on most tracks, but getting a gold is never too out of reach. It saddens me a little that doing tricks doesn't net you anything special besides cool points for yourself, but at the same time, it's one less thing I have to worry about if all I'm trying to do is unlock things. It allows you to play the game the way you want to, and having more options of playing the game is always better.

And even when you run out of tracks to do in the game, there is a track creation tool that can make more and be shared with the comminity, so you don't have to worry about stuff to do. The game is even getting DLC in the future with more tracks if community stuff isn't your thing, so there's an option for you there as well.

As far as negatives go, my complaints are very minor. While the stages themselves look amazing, all the stuff that's happening sometimes can be a little distracting from what you're doing. Or sometimes even the reverse is true, that you're so focused on your bike, you don't notice all the stuff happening around you when you want to see it. Another thing is that all of the stuff happeing in the background doesn't really effect what you're doing in the foreground. It's just fluff. I think it would've added a bit more diversity and dynamics if the stage interacted with the rider more.

There's also still a few bugs in the game or poor optimization. When I went to the create tool, it locked up my comp, which is a beast and shouldn't have any trouble loading anything. The same goes with how long it takes to select a ride at the beginning of the stages. I just stare at a black screen for a good while before something eventually pops up. But thankfully you can just press A to go to the course regardless, so it isn't that big of a deal.

So to sum it up, for 20 dollars, you're gonna have a blast with this title. It looks good, feels good, has a great sense of humor (the endings and the announcer make me laugh quite a bit), has potential to grow, and is fun with friends. Definitely pick this up, even more so when it goes on sale.
